11131.content:
Two days in and there's no denying it now, Ally thought as she stared at the heavy bulge her stomach had become. She pulled a loose shirt down to hide it, left her jeans unbuttoned, and for good measure threw on a hoodie. Those that know her might think she had just gained a few pounds. In her current gettup they wouldn't be able to tell it was mostly in her middle. And in another day it'd be impossible to hide. If she didn't solve this now there would be no way to pass the curse on to somebody else, and she'd be forced to go through it.

The terms were simple; nine days of pregnancy ending in a birth of unknown number unless somebody takes the curse from you. Ally had it all spelled out for her by her hugely pregnant, long-lost "friend" amid mocking laughter. She saw her shrink down to her former size and walk off, leaving Ally confused. Within minutes she was feeling sick, then hungry, then sick, then starving. She ate herself to sleep and woke up more bloated than when she went to bed.

That was two days ago, and now Ally knew she had to do something. She had no idea what would happen when she came to term, and she really didn't want to find out. She called Heather, who had given her this situation, begging her to explain what to do. Heather just laughed, telling her that there were other ways to lift the curse, but that this was just the easiest. The only hint that she gave was that it would require performing tasks, obtaining some strange objects, and that neither of them would have the means to go about doing that.

But Ally knew somebody who did. She was a frantic one when backed into a corner, and just two days of an accelerated pregnancy were enough to make her pick her target and strike, before she got any further along. She felt some pangs of guilt, but as the second day drifted toward the third, and her belly poked out further, the weight settling uncomfortably on her hips, the sudden spasms of uncontrollable hunger that turned her into a binging maniac until her stomach was satisfied. Granted, the friend she chose to pass this onto might panic even more, but with Ally to help the two of them might be able to stop the curse before the end.

The problem was, Ally had been trying all day calling her old friend and was getting nowhere. She knew she was in town, but she was in the middle of a pretty major movie, and just didn't have a lot of time for a social life. As Ally approached the end of her first rapid trimester she finally broke down, leaving a tearful message that she had to see her old friend Scarlett.

And Scarlett Johansson, however exhausted she might be from filming and physical training for the role, was just decent enough to at least take the time that night to invite Ally over to talk. Who knows? It might be good to get away from work for a night, and it never hurts to help a friend.

It wasn't a moment too soon for Ally. Approaching Scarlett's home, she felt a series of distinct fluttering movements inside of her. She had to stop and steady herself until they stopped, and then, taking a deep breath, approached and saw her beautiful friend already opening the door to greet her.

"Ally! Come on in and tell me all about it."

111311.content:
"Thanks for letting me come over," Ally said as the two sat down. "I know you're so busy, I just had no one else to turn to."

Scarlett leaned over and put a hand on Ally's knee with a look of real concern. It made Ally feel even more guilty, but not any less willing.

"What are friends for?" Scarlett said, "Production's winding down anyways. I only wish we could have spoke sooner, it's been so long."

"It has," Ally took a deep sigh. She would do the same thing Heather had done, just trick Scarlett into saying she'll accept whatever troubles she was having. Ally felt so stupid for falling for that now. Even then she thought Heather was phrasing things in a really weird, awkward manner.

"Scarlett, I have a problem."

"You're pregnant?" Scarlett asked. Ally was surprised, then realized that of course Scarlett could tell. Ally might be able to hide the so far subtle changes to her body from most people but her friend was somebody that was obsessed with her own figure, and so of course would notice that Ally was thicker in the middle than before.

"Oh, uh, no, it's not that. I have a, um, a burden . . ." Ally paused, feeling stupid in how she was saying this but not knowing any other way, "and I don't know who to turn to."

"Ally, you can talk to me about anything."

"I just need to unload this on somebody, you know?"

"Sure, I know, just let it all out. I'm here."

Ally got frustrated. She couldn't exactly ask Scarlett, "Hey, will you take this burden from me?" She'd sound like an idiot.

Scarlett saw her distress. "Hey, it's okay. Just tell me what's wrong. We'll figure it out together. Your problem is my problem."

Ally sat up straight as a unsettling, whirling feeling went through her stomach. Without thinking she gulped and grabbed her midsection. She felt it shrink down, felt the weight leave her, her jeans growing loose again, her body returning to its old self. The change was not nearly as dramatic as with Heather, though to Ally it was just as relieving. Apparently, Scarlett had stumbled onto a way to say "I accept your curse" as well as anything.

Scarlett looked confused by Ally's reaction.

"Ally, are you okay?"

"Oh, it's just, um, hearing you say that, really takes the weight off my shoulders," she said, smiling brightly. She understood why Heather was so gleefully pleased when she passed the curse onto Ally. Ally felt like she could just leave and be done with, she was so relieved. Even her friend's genuine concern for her seemed inconsequential.

Scarlett placed a hand over her stomach as it gurgled. Ally knew what she was feeling. Some queasiness, nothing big right now, but it would probably get worse soon. All Ally knew was that, at least nominally, this was Scarlett's problem now.

1113112.content:
A sudden queasiness had come over Scarlett. She rubbed her stomach gently to calm it before it got worse. She could see Ally could hear it and saw the look of concern, that had just quickly vanish, return. Something else had changed about her in the last few minutes, too. It really looked like a weight had been lifted from her shoulders, but it was more than that. Did she look different than when she had come in? Scarlett could have sworn her slim friend had looked a little puffy just moments before.

"Scarlett, I have something tell you. I'm really sorry."

"Don't be sorry, like I said you can tell me anything. I'm here for you," Scarlett felt a lurching sensation in her stomach. "Ooh," she moaned softly, doubling over as it passed as quickly as it came.

"I . . . I was pregnant."

"Ooh," Scarlett repeated, this time in apparent understanding.

"No, you don't understand. I was pregnant just a few minutes ago. I was a few months along. See?"

Ally stood up and lifted her hoodie, revealing her flat stomach and unbuttoned jeans. She rebuttoned them.

"You don't look pregnant. What do you mean a few minutes ago?"

"It's, well, you see, it was a curse," Ally said, grimacing at saying the word, "My friend Heather, you remember her, you two met once or twice, passed it to me. And I'm so sorry, but I didn't know what to do-"

"Ooooh, ow," Scarlett said, holding her hand up to signal Ally to stop for a moment as another wave of nausea hit her. "Sorry, go on, I'm not feeling so great right now."

"It's because now I . . . I passed it onto to you. And unless we follow some steps in a few days you're going to be full term."

Scarlett looked at Ally in silence. Ally couldn't tell what she was thinking, although it was clear the waves of nausea coming and going were distracting her from this conversation. After considering it for a few minutes, Scarlett spoke.

11131122.content:
"Ally," Scarlett had one arm around her stomach as she put a hand gently on Ally's shoulder, "I don't know what to tell you about that."

"I know, it's hard to believe, but-"

"Wait, Ally, listen to me. I've seen people having trouble like this before, and it's always easier to just go along."

Ally saw where she was going. "You don't understand, I'm not crazy. I mean, you already feel sick, don't you? That's morning sickness starting."

Scarlett's stomach growled as another bout of nausea had her doubled over before it passed. She shook it off the best she could. She continued in that firm but caring tone Ally had heard her take before when giving tough advice.

"You need to get help, Ally. I'm sorry to have to be so blunt with you but trust me it's for the best. I'll still be here for you, you know that."

"It sounds crazy, but I'm serious. We need to do something fast," Ally was starting to sound frantic, crazy even. She felt even guiltier now seeing that Scarlett was concerned for her mental well-being, but didn't get mad that she had tried to pass a curse onto her to save her own skin.

"Yes, we do. But not tonight. Look, I'm going to be busy for the next few days finishing up this film but I want you to know that you can call me at anytime and we can talk. Tomorrow night we can see each other again, okay?"

Scarlett stood up, and Ally rose with her. Scarlett was hunched over, her stomach in growing pain, a pulsating queasiness turning into a constant sensation rather than coming and vanishing as it just was.

"Scarlett, this is serious!"

"Ally!" Scarlett said, snapping as she took hold of Ally's shoulders. She knew she had to be firm but wanted Ally to know that she really did care. She wasn't just trying to throw her out and forget about this. One of her oldest friends was clearly having a mental breakdown. Scarlett was feeling horrible right now but she wanted Ally to know that she wasn't going to abandon her. "I need you to go home, okay? We'll talk about this more tomorrow."

Ally stammered. She had no idea how to convince her friend that this was real and not just delusional ravings. She pressed her hand against Scarlett's groaning stomach, causing Scarlett to jump back, apparently in pain.

"Ally, calm down. Go home. Get some rest. Call me tomorrow."

Scarlett moaned as her stomach gurgled and sickened under her arm.

Ally didn't know what to say. On the verge of tears, at what she had done to her friend and her friend's inability to believe her, she turned to leave. They exchanged hugs, and both promised to speak tomorrow. Ally thought that by tomorrow night Scarlett might be more willing to listen, and Scarlett thought the same about Ally.

111311221.content:
Scarlett was ready for bed. She had to do some more final shots tomorrow and wanted to be rested. But first, this sudden stomach bug had to be dealt with. She dry-heaved on her bathroom for ten minutes, gulping down peptobismal, until she picked herself up and walked off to bed. Her stomach growled at her. Inexplicably just as she was starting to feel the nausea pass, she was hungry.

She was worried about her friend, of course, but Scarlett's first priority was finishing this movie. There was definitely a Black Widow franchise waiting to start if her first solo picture was a hit. Her part in all that was almost done. After that she could give her full attention to Ally. She had seen friends go off the deep end before, but never as suddenly as Ally seemed to have done. Scarlett drifted off into a fitful sleep, her hand gently rubbing her groaning tummy . . .


"Scarlett, stand still, we just have to do one final fitting," Marie the costume designer said.

"I am standing still," Scarlett said, but she fidgeted. The costume was skin tight, and while not uncomfortable was not the easiest thing to wear. Today it felt particular troublesome. She tugged at it until Marie slapped her hand.

"Stop that," she said. Scarlett's hands came to rest of her stomach. Her focus was there for some reason.

"You're always so worried because you gain in your stomach first," Marie said.

"Hey," Scarlett said, not in the mood to teased. The costume did feel a little snug around her middle, though.

"It's true. I think we'll have to take it out a little here."

Marie poked Scarlett's stomach. Scarlett looked down to see that, indeed, she looked bloated. She covered it self-consciously.

"Uhg, this is not my day," she said. She felt, and heard, a creaking from her middle as the tight fabric grew even tighter across her stomach. "Oh, come on, what's this?"

Marie looked over, along with some of the crew. She smirked and said in a mean voice Scarlett had never heard her use.

"Just let it all out for us, Scarlett," Marie said, to the chuckles of the crew.

Scarlett hid her stomach with her hands.

"This isn't funny," Scarlett said, then the wind was knocked out of her. She felt her stomach jump forward into her hands. The belt buckle of her costume flew off, and the fabric seemed to stretch enough to not tear.

"Oh, god!" Scarlett yelled as she held her now round stomach in her hands. It felt full, heavy, firm. "Somebody get help!"

The crew laughed, their expressions saying that they saw this coming all along and that Scarlett only had herself to blame.

"This isn't normal, something's growing inside me!" Scarlett yelled at them, still holding onto her stomach. Another pressure went through her, and her belly jutted out even further. She looked, and felt, very pregnant. It knocked her back into the make up chair behind her. The zipper on her costume was straining to rip open. She gripped her belly in a panic. Without warning the crew had surrounded her. Scarlett tried to get up, but another burst of growth pushed her back into her chair. She felt wiggling inside her, each little kick feeling like it would be too much for her already taut skin.

"It . . . it's too much!" she said, pleading with her eyes for them to help.

"You couldn't have waited until after filming was done? Now we'll have to use CG to make you look normal," the director said, shaking his head. Nobody seemed to understand how terrified Scarlett was. Another wave of growth hit her. Her stomach was at full term or maybe even beyond that. She was bound to the chair by it, unable to move. She shook her body, grunting and yelping, trying to get up and maybe get somewhere where people would help her.

Marie leaned forward and placed a calming hand on Scarlett's belly.

"Help," Scarlett pleaded.

"Aw, I think they're coming," Marie said.

Scarlett threw her head back in pain as every muscle in her body contracted. Her belly throbbed inward, and then expanded again. She gritted her teeth to keep from screaming. With ever breath she was her stomach grow, her zipper tearing open revealing her taut, pale belly. It grew, and grew, and Scarlett knew she couldn't take anymore . . .


Scarlett woke up, groggy and in a cold sweat. The dream, or nightmare really, faded from her mind. All she remembered was that she dreamed somewhat was wrong with her body, that it would impact filming, and that nothing she could do would make it better. Her mind, and hands, seemed very oddly drawn to her midsection this morning.

Grrrrrrrrg . . .

She patted her stomach. She remembered she went to bed hungry, so a big breakfast was in order. Exactly how big she didn't realize until she slowly made her way to the kitchen and realized that two bowls of cereal, a stack of five waffles, and half a gallon of milk weren't doing the trick.

"What is with you today?" she said softly to her stomach. She could either keep eating until it was settled--a prospect that unnerved her given her troubled history with keeping in shape--or ignore and get to work.

1113112211.content:
Scarlett still had a few hours before she had to get to the set. In the meantime, she'd have to find something, anything, to settle her stomach. She couldn't help but thinking that the gnawing hunger was just a strange stomach ache. But, hunger it was, and Scarlett had never had any trouble giving into her appetite when it called. She was already full by the time she finished her unusually large breakfast. Her stomach pressed lightly against the belt of her robe, feeling full and a little bloated. She patted it and growled. She might give into her urges between films, but this last one was just nearly finished. And it was getting harder and harder to get back into shape, she knew, so it was more important than ever to keep her figure in check.

And yet, Scarlett scoured her kitchen for something to eat. A bag of potato chips, mostly full, looked oddly appealing. Without thinking she grabbed it and began shoveling the chips into her mouth without even sitting down, crumbs and grease covering her hands. She thought little of wiping them on her silk robe afterwards. Minutes later, she was done, and looking to the next item in her cabinet. Her stomach growled and rolled, demanding even more food.

"Jesus Christ, this is ridiculous," she whispered in annoyance. Next to the chips was an unopened box of muffins. This she took down and took the trouble to actually sit. One by one she took them out, finishing each in four or five bites. She was beyond her normal level of full, even for when she'd let herself go after staying in shape for a production. She wasn't even tasting them, just biting, chewing, and swallowing, just trying to get as much nutrients into her body as she could.

Finally, Scarlett had decided enough was enough. Or rather, her stomach decided. The last few muffins had to be forced down like her stomach was getting so full only a superhuman effort could pack any more food into it. Unsteadily, Scarlett went to get dressed. She found walking uncomfortable on such a full stomach. Her breasts, too, she found oddly tender and a little swollen. If she could just put off the onset of "Fat Scarlett" for two more days she could finish filming and focus on maybe not turning into a blob after.

If Scarlett thought walking on a full stomach was uncomfortable she found her clothes to be even more so. She groaned, sliding up a pair of tight jeans over her legs and finding the button just not clasping. She tried sucking in and couldn't. It was fat--yet--it was food. With much struggling she finally closed her pants, although sitting down would be problematic for at least a few hours. A loose-fitting t-shirt mostly hid her food baby. She just hoped it would go down before she had to be in costume. She couldn't remember what she'd be wearing on the set today, but she dreaded having to wear it if this bump was still showing.

She massaged her stomach through her shirt. That soothed it somewhat, although the thought that this is what pregnant women often do made her stop. She recalled Ally's crazy warning the night before. Could that have effected her somewhat? She hoped not. Scarlett was sympathetic towards Ally's breakdown, although would be less so if that breakdown was making her binge uncontrollably.

Scarlett's stomach began rumbling again as she went to her car to get to the set. She rolled her eyes, rubbing it again to calm it. As carefully as she sat down, Scarlett couldn't avoid her jeans popping open. She moaned in frustration. At least once her food baby went down, the day would go smoothly from there.
1113112211.title: Scarlett's big breakfast.

choices: Scarlett stuffs herself again at lunch
Scarlett holds off and stays on the set to hurry things up
11131122111.content:
Scarlett felt many temptations to stop and get more food along the way. She resisted them, though, her unbuttoned jeans a crude warning of what lay on that path. When she arrived on set she made sure to suck in her stomach as much as she could and rebutton her pants. It was uncomfortable, and she kept rubbing her full stomach unconsciously.

She arrived on set and right straight to costume. Marie was waiting. She looked her up and down. Did Marie notice Scarlett's food baby? It made her annoyed that it must be readily apparent that she had been pigging out all morning.

"'Morning, Scarlett," Marie said. She had a slinky cocktail dress ready. That's right, Scarlett remembered. They needed some insert shots for a party scene early in the movie. There were only a skeleton cast of extras for this. Nobody really had any lines at least for this scene. Scarlett just had to look pretty, something she was normally perfectly confident she could do.

Except that today the dress was snug around her middle. She cursed her reflection. She had gained weight before and knew the signs, the just didn't usually come on so quickly. Not to mention that the top was feeling too tight around her breasts. She had worn this same dress not days before and it fit like a glove. A sexy glove.

She just hoped nobody would notice. She left her dressing room to have Marie approach her with a look of exaggerated surprise.

"Honey, just one more day then you can eat whatever you want," Marie said sweetly.

Scarlett glared and was about to come back with a snarky comment, but then Marie playfully patted her stomach. When Scarlett was in a bad mood like this, should could lash out if rubbed the wrong way. But instead of slapping her hand away as she wanted to do, Scarlett just accepted the unwelcome patting. Maybe Marie could tell that it was hard, the sure sign of eating recently and not of fat, and maybe she couldn't. But Scarlett had no comeback.

"I need to get to make-up," Scarlett said.

She heard Marie mutter something about make-up not being used on her gut, but she ignored it.

Sitting for a half hour in the make-up chair was no more comfortable. Her tight dressed pinched her middle and she was positive her breasts would spill out. They didn't, and she survived.

If anybody else noticed they didn't say anything. Famed Swedish director Hans Petersen didn't, at least, and he was a stickler for continuity. The first half of the day was mostly taken up with setting up shots and then filming for a few seconds, setting up again, filming again. Scarlett grew antsy, irritable. The others must have sensed it because they steered clear of her. It was unlike Scarlett to be snippy with her co-workers, and even she wasn't sure why she was so generally angry today. It wasn't just her clothes not fitting, although the sensation that her dress was somehow getting tighter as the day wore on didn't help. Something else was bugging her. It could only be Ally, she thought. She was worried for, and annoyed by, her friend. But Ally certain didn't make Scarlett eat so much that morning. And she wasn't causing Scarlett to constantly touch her stomach. She would have sat on her hands to stop herself if she was sitting. Eventually the director called her over and said gently.

"Scarlett, don't touch your belly so much, it makes me think that you are pregnant."

Scarlett reddened, and stopped herself from exploding at him. "I'm just really full, is all."

"I can tell," Hans laughed.

Scarlett was famished by lunch time. She went to leave the set to get some food. On the way she passed by Hans and his editor looking at shots.

She stopped short when she saw two shots of the same sequence, filmed three hours apart. They both showed her in full profile. She started rubbing her stomach gently again. There was no denying that her stomach looked just a little bigger on the later shot than before. The director noticed it, too. He shook his head and said, quietly and in his thick Swedish accent.

"Just another day and she can get as fat as she wants until the next Avengers," and then laughed a little.

Scarlett didn't laugh, though.
11131122111.title: Filler shots for a fuller Scarlett

The suit won't close up front, the body double has to step in.
111311221111.content:
Scarlett changed into her regular clothes before going to lunch. The dress had gotten too uncomfortable, and she was disappointed to find her jeans were no better. Her stomach was puffing out, no question about it, and even buttoning her pants was a chore. Fortunately her shirt was long enough to cover it. If someone really looked at her they could tell she was bloated, but at a passing glance she still looked like the same slim, sexy Scarlett. Every few steps her jeans popped open, and after a few tries she gave up. It was hidden at least.

Scarlett's stomach grew louder as she drove down the street looking for food. She knew it was a mistake, but light headed from hunger and feeling pissed off at everything, she pulled through the drive through of a burger joint. She simply couldn't help herself. She ordered three large burgers, and a bag full of fries, then a large soda. The only bright side was the surprised smile she got from the cashier at the window. He must have been knew, she thought, since otherwise he wouldn't be phased by actors coming by. Still, it made her feel good to be looked at like that considering how gross she felt.

She ate in her car in the back of the studio parking lot. "Ate" is somewhat inaccurate, "devoured" would be a better term. She showed some restraint with her first burger, but the other two went down like there was no tomorrow. She slurped her soda, too, shoving fries into her face. It was like she couldn't stop herself, as though some outside force was telling her she really needed to eat all this and then some. With still half her lunch break to go, Scarlett was done. The seatbelt was digging into her stomach so she undid it and rubbed her tummy, gently moaning. Once again, she had stuffed herself as full as she thought she could possibly be, and there was no way the effects wouldn't be obvious. Her stomach was hard to the touch. Slouching back in the seat her food baby poked up from her shirt, however loose it might be. Scarlett groaned, belching to let some of the pressure out. It didn't help.

Curiously, she lifted up her shirt to look at her puffy stomach. She could joke about her "Fat Scarlett" mode after the fact, but seeing it come on so quickly and at the very end of a production was depressing. She knew she had better will power than this. Her stomach felt not only bloated, but sore and heavy. The skin felt stretched even. It wasn't any consolation that the puffiness was firm, and not soft and jiggly. She rubbed her stomach, soothing it, although very self conscious by what the director had told her that looked like.

Scarlett eventually worked up the courage, after her stomach had settled again, to go back to costuming and get ready for the next half of the day. As before, there would be more insert shots. Most of the extras had already left, actually. She passed by her body double on the way inside. She shuddered. She was wearing the sexy spy suit, which meant that Scarlett would have to stuff herself into that same suit. It was a little stretchy, so she should be able to handle it, but the pressure on her poor stomach, and whether or not the zipper would hold were another matter. She didn't feel like she could do anything too acrobatic today, should the director call for it.

Skinny bitch, Scarlett found herself sneering inwardly at her body double. The uncharacteristic sentiment must have shown on her face, since her expression went from a friend wave and a smile to looking away, confused and a little annoyed. Scarlett was getting angrier at Ally (who had left half a dozen unchecked messages on her phone by this point) for her crazy outburst last night. No doubt Scarlett wouldn't be in such a rotten mood if not for her. In the back of her mind she knew that was unfair. Ally might have thrown a damper on her night, but she was clearly having emotional problems, and it's not like Ally was making Scarlett stuff herself with grease and fat.

"Well, Scarlett, let's get you . . . into this," Marie said as Scarlett arrived in the costume department. There was an infuriating smirk on Marie's face that Scarlett suddenly felt the urge to smack off. She subdued it and answered calmly, except that to calm herself her hands went instinctively toward her stomach, rubbing it through her shirt.

"Here," Scarlett said as she took the costume, "I can do it myself."

"Let me know if you need help with the zipper," Marie said. There was some hidden smirks, and some giggling, all around. No doubt Scarlett's pissy attitude all day didn't make anyone sympathetic to her plight.

Scarlett whirled back around and said, knowing she should just ignore it but not able to help herself, "What do you mean by that?"

Marie's eyes went wide and her smile vanished, "Nothing, Scarlett, I'm just saying if you need help that's why we're here."

Despite Marie backing out and the other crew members pretending to go about their business, Scarlett wouldn't--or couldn't, her emotions flaring up in a frighteningly uncharacteristic fashion--let it go. Actually, everybody had mostly gotten along during the entire shooting. Marie could be snooty sometimes but Scarlett never let it bother her before today.

"I know how to dress myself," Scarlett reddened as she continued, the rational part of her pleading with her to stop talking and get dressed, "If you're implying that I'm too fat for this now then you are sadly mistaken. I'm a professional, and I don't blow up the last days of shooting, and just because I'm a little bloated doesn't give you the right to treat me like I'm some new kid who doesn't know how shoot a movie."

Marie was leveling her hands in a calming motion as Scarlett spoke, her voice becoming shrill and trembling, like she was about to cry. She could tell Marie felt bad, even though they both knew that if any offense was intended it was nowhere the amount Scarlett was taking out of it. Without missing a beat Scarlett looked ashamed at herself.

"I'm sorry, Marie," she said quietly, and then walked quickly to her dressing room, "Sorry, sorry . . ."

"It's okay, Scarlett!" Marie had to yell so she would hear Scarlett had left so quickly. She shrugged and looked at the others. "So, we're pretty much all in agreement? She's pregnant right? Mood swings, swelling?"

The others nodded in understanding. Despite her teasing, Marie had worked with Scarlett on other pictures and actually did like her, and wanted to make sure everyone who didn't work as closely with her as she did that this was definitely not normal behavior for the actor.
111311221111.title: Stuffing off the set

choices: Scarlett answers and goes to meet Ally.
Scarlett ignores Ally, goes home, and eats and sleeps.
1113112211111.content:
In a rare, but familiar, few moments of further self doubt, Scarlett had to stare at herself in the dressing room mirror and convince herself that she looked fine. Fantastic even. Just as gorgeous and sexy as always. Her stomach was obviously puffy, there was no getting around that, but the rest of her was still perfect. As her belly led the way Jennifer kept having to sooth those wiggling feelings inside her. They were fleeting and subtle, but growing stronger each time. Why couldn't she just belch and be rid of it? At least letting some gas out would relieve how full she felt. But no, they kept popping up, then fading away with a little gentle massaging. Funny how she didn't even want to look at her stomach and yet couldn't help but touch it constantly.

Jennifer should have gone grocery shopping. Still, the smell of simple ingredients as she entered the kitchen was satisfying. She had bread? Some lunch meat? She made a few sandwiches, stacking them high, arranging on her kitchen table. That wasn't enough, though. She took out some bags of chips and and snacks, plopping them there, too. She knew she wouldn't want to get up again, so was planning on an all-night binge without moving. She wanted a desert, something rich, and so a cheese cake brought by a friend would do for that. Jennifer would rarely indulge such treats herself, but feeling this hungry, and already so big, she took it without a second thought.

Jennifer eased herself into the chair and started eating. She had to lean back, but still mostly avoided getting crumbs all over her inflated chest, despite the speed that she wolfed down one, two, then three sandwiches. She could feel a tightness deep inside her, her lower belly getting full. She patted it and loosened the string on her sweatpants. She did this practically without thought, just as she thoughtless tore open the chips and began, cleanly but quickly, stuffing them into her mouth. She couldn't tell when the pain of hunger was replaced by the pain of fullness, but she was certainly she was well beyond any normal capacity now. She slouched and rubbed her sore sides that rose up into the belly. Still, the cheesecake was there. Fork in hand, Jennifer proceeded to eat it, bite by bite, growing so stuffed that she thought she could feel her skin stretching with each bite. But it didn't matter to her, not right then, because that hunger had to be satisfied. Jennifer thought she felt the chair creak beneath her. It was just her imagination, of course, but she was sure she must be so full now that she'd find it hard to stand, at least.

The sun began to rise when Jennifer awoke from her mindless stupor. She was exhausted, but finally satisfied. Her stomach groaned and gurgled, that wiggling feeling returning, stronger than last night. She leaned back in her chair, unable to stand for the moment. Her belly had definitely grown. With all she had eaten, it was no wonder, but Jennifer couldn't explain how it looked rounder even than last night. Eyes half closed with exhaustion, she rubbed her her stomach and then gasped. Her fingers reached a little bump right where her belly button should be.

"That's impossible," she said, "You can't pop out your belly button from eating," but her eyes saw it even if her mind couldn't believe it. She rubbed it. It felt just as strained and sensitive as the rest of her stomach.

"Jennifer! Oh my god, what is going on here?"

Jennifer, shamed, worried, and surprised, looked up to see Melissa.

"I . . . I don't know," Jennifer teared up, but controlled herself. "I know I've gained weight, but I never ate this much. Nobody can eat this much. I know it's impossible, but it just feels so much like I'm really, you know, pregnant . . ."

"Okay, okay, okay," Melissa paced, thinking hard, glancing with unbelieving stares at Jennifer's hopelessly swollen body, "You have an appointment in a few hours, but I think-

"We should go right now." Melissa finished. "Right. Could you help me up?" Jennifer asked. Melissa obliged, pulling Jennifer up with all her might. Her belly was huge. She looked overdue, and looked like she would go into labor if she sneezed. But unfortunately for Jennifer, this wasn't the case.

The two exited the house, Jennifer waddling behind, getting used to her heavy stomach. From all angles, members of the paparazzi appeared, snapping pictures of Jennifer. "You guys are a bunch of pigs! Can't you respect a person's privacy?" Melissa asked, shooing away the photographers as Jennifer sat in the passenger seat of her car.

Melissa got in the driver's seat and started the car, pulling out of Jennifer's driveway. Melissa looked over at Jennifer, noticing how distressed she was. "You alright, Jen?" she asked. "I just...don't know what's happening to me..." she said, her eyes tearing up. She stared down at her belly, noticing how constricted the seatbelt made it.

"Just try to relax. Take a deep breath, close your eyes. It'll be alright." Melissa said, patting Jennifer on the shoulder. Jennifer nodded, closing her eyes, breathing in and out. She was actually getting relaxed, until she felt it. A strong THUMP coming from her belly. She jolted in her seat, trying to locate exactly where it came from. Then she felt it again, but in another place.

"Are you okay?" Melissa asked, her eyes switching between the road and Jennifer. "I...I don't know..." she replied, feeling around her rotund belly. They arrived at the doctor's office, as Melissa exited the car and helped Jennifer inside. Melissa checked in with the receptionist while Jennifer took a seat. It was a tight squeeze, but she was able to fit.

"Hi. I'm checking in for Jennifer Lawrence. She has an appointment with Dr. Anderson." Melissa said to the receptionist. She checked her computer, looking at the schedule. "The appointment is three hours away..." she noted.

"Right. We would have come on time, but...she thinks she's...having contractions." Melissa lied. The receptionist looked at Jennifer, seeing how large she was. Now, Melissa actually didn't believe that Jennifer was pregnant. After all, she hadn't had sex in over a year. But any random passerby would have believed that she was definitely pregnant if they saw her, so Melissa ran with it.

"Oh...alright then. Just have a seat in the first examination room to the left, and I'll go get Dr. Anderson." the receptionist said, getting up from her seat, her eyes glued to Jennifer's belly. Melissa helped Jennifer out of her chair, and the two went to the exam room.

Inside, Jennifer heaved herself up onto the metallic examination table, while Melissa took a seat nearby. After a few moments of waiting, Dr. Anderson arrived. He was a grey-haired man in his late 40s, who was the doctor for a lot of celebrities.

"Wow. The receptionist told me about this, but I didn't believe her. So you're having contractions?" he asked. "No, I actually just said that so we could see you as soon as we could. You see, Jennifer's not actually pregnant. She can't be!" Melissa said adamantly. "Really? Are you sure?" he asked.

"Dr. Anderson, I haven't had sex in over a year. It's impossible." Jennifer said, breaking her silence. "I see. Well, there are a few medical cases that may explain what is happening to your stomach. When did this start?" he asked. "About two days ago. It's been growing ever since." Jennifer replied. "Have you been eating large amounts of food in a short amount of time recently?" he asked.

Almost on queue, her stomach rumbled. "You could say that." Jennifer said. "There have been some cases of extreme bloating after eating. That might be what's happening. Would you mind laying down for a moment?" he asked. Jennifer obliged, lying down on the cold table. The doctor pulled back her shirt, and began examining it. "Huh. It's quite firm." he noted.

"Tell me about it." Jennifer replied, trying to look over her belly. Dr. Anderson pulled out a stethoscope, and placed it against the surface of the round orb that was her stomach. He placed it in a few different places, hearing what was inside. "Interesting. Very interesting. Ladies, I'll be right back." he said exiting the room. Dr. Anderson returned a few moments later with an ultrasound machine.

He pulled out a bottle of blue gel, and began shaking it. "Now, this might be a little cold." he said, applying the gel to Jennifer's belly, who shivered. He flipped a few switches, and grabbed a wand attached to the machine. The doctor maneuvered the wand around Jennifer's belly for about a minute. "Oh...oh my..." he said, his jaw dropped.

"What is it?!?" Jennifer and Melissa asked at the same time. "You're pregnant..." he revealed. Melissa gasped, but Jennifer was silent. She had a feeling that this was the case. "But how?" Melissa asked. "I'm not entirely sure. In fact, it appears that the babies are growing at a tiny rate as we speak..." Dr. Anderson said, his eyes glued to the monitor.

"Wait! Did you say BABIES?" Melissa asked, her eyes glued to Jennifer's impossibly swollen belly. "Yes. Jennifer, you're pregnant with octuplets. A little over four months along." he said. Jennifer cried. Not only was she pregnant, seemingly at a rapid rate, but with eight babies. It was too much to swallow. The silence was interrupted by Melissa's phone ringing. "Sorry, I've got to take this." she said, exiting the room.

"Now, Jennifer, I know how unbelievable this must seem. But with the number of babies you're having and the rate you're growing, you might be having these babies sooner than you think. Maybe even by the end of the week. I don't know how this happened, but I want to examine you over the next few days to see how and why this is happening. I'll make house visits and it'll be free of charge. Okay?" he asked. Jennifer slowly nodded her head as Melissa entered the room and Dr. Anderson exited it.

"That was Catt Sadler, Jennifer. She saw the pictures from today, and she wants a follow up interview tomorrow. I said that you'd do it. We'd look really, really bad if you lied about your pregnancy on camera. We'll get through this together, alright?" Melissa asked, placing a hand on Jennifer's belly.

"O..okay." she replied, still dumbfounded at the revelation. "Alright, so we should probably get going. Where do you wanna go?"

11222122112211.content:
"I think I need new clothes," Jennifer tugged at the bottom of her shirt, already tighter and riding up more than it was this morning. Her belly button was pressing out, clearly visible. "I mean, more new clothes."

"You're right," Melissa said, "And it'll probably cheer you up."

Jennifer actually smiled. "Because nothing cheers up an actress like dressing up her fat body."

Melissa chuckled, then abruptly stopped when she saw Jennifer's expression had gone back to its stunned, blank state. They drove on mostly in silence. Arriving at the mall, not packed during the middle of a weekday, Melissa saw Jennifer shifting in her shirt, rubbing her stomach with more discomfort than before.

"What's wrong?"

"I think . . . I'm growing," she said softly.

Melissa pressed her hand to Jennifer's belly. She felt a few kicks. Jennifer winced, brushing her hand away. "Let's go."

Jennifer's mood didn't exactly lighten, but by walking through the mall like a normal person, she could at least pretend that everything was all right. She could pretend this was a perfectly normal pregnancy and was just hanging out with her friend/agent. Of course, that's not to say her mood got better, just that instead of feeling shocked and scared, she now felt frustration bordering on anger. Every few steps Jennifer stumbled, and took great effort to steady herself without falling over. Her hips wobbled too far to the side, her belly too far up front, as if every part of her body was conspiring to make the simple act of moving around into a humiliating and awkward challenge. Melissa kept trying to catch her, but Jennifer just glared and snapped at her.

"Relax, Jennifer, we'll get through this," Melissa repeated.

Jennifer just glared, at Melissa and the typically beautiful L.A. people around her. She didn't seen to hear her. "Why did I think going to place packed with normal, pretty, thin people would make me feel better?"

The reached the maternity store. Jennifer was nearly out of breath. Her feet and her back ached. She had to stop and catch her breath.

"Melissa, I'm going to go hide in the changing room, okay? Just bring me some clothes and let's make this fast."

"Sure," Melissa said, but Jennifer was already waddling to the back of the store. A salesperson or two approached her, but Jennifer shot them a look that made them back off.

Jennifer waited for fifteen minutes while Melissa scoured the store for pregnant versions of Jennifer's casual clothes, and a few dresses. She knew her star client's size perfectly, and surprisingly didn't find it hard to accommodate for her recent changes. Jennifer spent those fifteen minutes at first staring in wonder at those very changes. Her belly was huge, looking full term, she thought, the skin so tight she wondered how she could grow anymore. Her breasts were swollen to almost comical proportions. Her hips and ass had swelled, too, although not nearly as much as Jennifer imagined. Her face had started to fill out ever so slightly since the morning.

"Why does everything have to get so big?" she said to herself, pressing a finger into her softer cheek. She thought that blow particularly tragic, then smiled to herself that it was the least of her that had plumped up recently.

"Hey, Jennifer, you okay?"

"I'm fine, what do you have?"

"I have a few pair of jeans-"

"How am I supposed to fit into jeans?" Jennifer snapped, "Have you seen my ass lately?"

"They're pregnancy jeans, the front's elastic so no more popped buttons. And a couple of t-shirts-"

"Will they still cover my stomach by tomorrow?"

"-And some dresses for you to try on. Here you go," Melissa nudged the door open and plopped the clothes down. She didn't linger, or ask if she needed help.

Awkwardly, Jennifer managed to try on a pair of jeans and a shirt. She had to hand it to Melissa, she picked well. Jennifer wasn't pleased with how everything looked on her, but it covered her up and wasn't too restrictive. She posed for the mirror, rubbing her belly, arching her back, like a model in a maternity catalog. Surprisingly, it actually did make her feel better, if only because the situation was feeling more normal now. She pushed back thoughts of how two days ago she never would have even thought of being there.

"Jennifer, you okay?"

Jennifer stepped out, now dressed like a proper pregnant woman in public. She managed a smile. Melissa gave her the thumbs up and smiled back.

"Looking good," she said, and she meant it. She stopped herself from using the word 'glow," but she really did think that, for all of Jennifer's self-degredation, pregnancy was not an awful look for her.

"As good as can be given this," Jennifer said, rubbing her belly. "Nice work, by the way, everything fits great. It might not by the end of the day . . ."

Jennifer's belly growled, echoing in the changing room. Even she looked surprised. The hunger was on her again, going from uncomfortable to near pain quickly.

"Oh, Melissa, I . . . I . . ."

"I know, let's go pay and we'll get some food."

"No, I was going to ask you to stop me from eating. If I start again, I won't stop until I'm passed out on the floor like a stuffed pig."

"Come on, you need to eat, you're--well, you know."

"Eating for nine, huh?" Jennifer said, sighing. She knew she couldn't resist this hunger again. And besides, how much more damage could it do.

As they left the store, Melissa carrying several boxes and Jennifer decked out in sensible-yet-fashionable materinitywear, Jennifer stopped her waddle for a moment. During the entire time she was changing, it never occurred to her to remove her new necklace. She just changed around it. But as soon as the thought entered her mind, her belly rumbled, and she pressed onward.

Predictably, it took longer than Jennifer would have liked to get to the food court. Her confident strides had become an awkward shuffle as she desperately tried to avoid waddling. This was getting next to impossible. The weight of her belly forced her forward, and each step caused her increasingly wide hips to sway more to the side. At least now she was dressed as comfortably as she could be in public. In fact, shopping, walking around, despite the discomfort and feeling like a parade float, Jennifer was starting to feel almost normal. She wasn't sure this was a good thing.

"Er, you sure you don't want to go some place nicer?"

"Okay, okay," Melissa said gently, "What can I get you?"

Jennifer smiled despite herself, surprised that it actually made her feel good to hear that.

Melissa made half a dozen trips, each time bringing back a tray full of burgers, or cheap mall pizza, or cheap mall Chinese food, and each time Jennifer was nearly done by the time she made it back. Jennifer ate like a machine, as before. Her hands methodically stuffing her mouth, only stopping from time to time to rub her swelling belly and force a burp out. As big as she already was, Jennifer could feel herself growing heavier as she ate, forcing her further down in her chair. Her clothes were less restrictive now, the belly band of her maternity jeans easily stretching to allow her belly to grow. Her shirt draped down over her entire middle. Jennifer kept wanting to pull it down to cover herself, and was relieved to see she was already covered. By the time she was tine, her belly somehow felt even tighter than before. I forgot that I'm going to have to breastfeed. That'll be great." she said sarcastically, stepping into the shower.

Jennifer put on a pair of the larger sweatpants she bought the other day, and a t-shirt which came down to her belly button.

Jennifer slept like a log even with all her discomfort. She was actually surprised to find herself slowly awaking the next morning, the sun telling her that it was already getting close to noon. With a grunt, she attempted to heave herself up from her side and fell back down. She sighed, pulling back her covers to reveal a belly that was somehow even larger and heavier than yesterday. She pressed the taut skin with her hands, a flurry of kicks responding.

"How much bigger can I get?" she said softly. With effort, she was able to sit up. With even greater effort, she rocked herself out of bed. Her hips popped, and she had to spread her legs and practically sway from side to side to move forward without toppling over. She rubbed her aching back with one hand and her sore, round belly with the other.

While brushing her teeth and combing her hair she was somewhat surprised how much calmer she was this morning. The first two days were all panic, the next self-loathing, but today it seemed almost normal. Well, obviously nothing about carrying eight rapidly growing babies was normal, but the harsh edge of the situation had dulled. Now Jennifer could look at her bulbous stomach and, while certainly wishing it wasn't there, was no longer freaking out at the sight. She might grown while pulling on a pair of sweat pants and noting how her hips and ass were unfortunately growing to match her belly, but it seemed more like an inconvenience rather than a tragedy.

Her puffy face, though, Jennifer was still self-conscious enough to scowl at. She might have dwelt on it had the smell of breakfast sent her tummy into a whirl of hunger. Even the stairs were no obstacle to her, however cautiously she took them.

She found Melissa and Dr. Anderson in the kitchen.

"Good . . . morning?" Jennifer couldn't quite place it, but something was off about Melissa. No, not off, just different. She turned to Jennifer and smiled.

"Lots of eggs, lots of bacon, some bagels, enough for at least nine people," Melissa said, laughing.

"Good morning, Jennifer," Dr. Anderson said, standing to help Jennifer take a seat. She accepted while it dawned on her what was different. Melissa was acting almost motherly towards her. She was always a friend, but also an agent, but now, after two days of strangeness and constant contact, Jennifer could quite clearly see that Melissa was looking at her and talking to her in a gentle, loving manner that seemed somewhat out of place.

Jennifer, however, was too busy stuffing her face to think further on the change. Besides, hadn't Jennifer changed in a much more drastic way these last few days? She wasn't even self-conscious about her appetite in front of the doctor. He sat patiently, eating a plate of waffles which she realized Melissa must have made for her. If pregnancy makes Melissa want to help and take care of her, Jennifer decided, that was all right with her. If her current growth was any indicator she'd hardly be able to stand by tomorrow, let alone the weekend.

"Jennifer-" Dr. Anderson started.

"Food first. Questions later," Jennifer muttered between mouthfulls. If she had stopped to think she would have been shocked to see how quickly she had gotten used to eating for nine.

The doctor obliged. Finally, Jennifer sat back with a belch. She held her stomach in her hand, shifting constantly, unable to get comfortable feeling this full and huge.

She smirked at the doctor, who wore a curious but not surprised expression, "Think I'm putting on too much baby weight?"

"Oh, no, although, have you grown since last night?"

"What do you think?" Jennifer shifted, holding her enormous stomach. Her shirt rode up to reveal her belly button now fully popped out. She looked more than full term now.

"Let's get you looked at."

The two helped Jennifer to the couch, where they repeated the procedure from yesterday. Jennifer was no longer cringing at each kick she felt, or at others rubbing her stomach. Of course, she would be much happier when there was less of it to rub.

"Perfectly healthy. You gotta' be around 20, 21 weeks now, though. Maybe 22. Hard to tell, though, I've never seen octuplets developed this fully. It's like each of them is growing as much as a single fetus."

Jennifer's eyes popped at the realization, her morning calm shaken.

"Doctor, just how much are they going to grow?"

"Now there's no need to panic," Dr. Anderson said, taking Jennifer's blood pressure, "Can't believe it myself, but I'm seeing it, and you're growing to fit them. Not sure how it's possible but we're seeing it with our own eyes. And so far you're looking as healthy as ever."

Dr. Anderson had Melissa bring the scale out. Jennifer stood on it, dreading what it would read.

"She was around 135 before, uh, this happened," Melissa said helpfully. Jennifer couldn't see over her belly to read.

"Well, she's pushing 200, but not unusual for a pregnancy, especially one this unusual," the doctor chuckled, but stifled it when he saw Jennifer glaring at her.

Jennifer lowered herself back down while Dr. Anderson packed up.

"Jennifer, I'll stop by tonight. Let me know when you're back from this interview. I'll be discreet like always, no need to worry about any of this getting out from me."

"Thanks, Doctor, I really appreciate this," Jennifer shook his hand.

"Yes, thanks, Doctor," Melissa said sweetly, seeing him to the door. Jennifer turned on the TV, predictably seeing Catt Sadler discussing celebrity gossip.

"I'm starting to hate that woman," Jennifer said while Melissa sat next to her. "I'd like to see how she likes waking up a two-hundred-pound blob and still have to go out in public." But there really wasn't hatred in Jennifer's voice. Maybe some annoyance. "Do I really have to do this interview?"

"I wish you didn't, but we agreed to it. Don't worry, I've taken care of everything. Here," she pulled aside a script, "this was making the rounds a few years ago but then the whole Octomom thing happened and people though no one would take it seriously. Glance through it, no need to go into details, but just something you can reference secretly when pressed, okay? I'm making some calls to some friends, I'm looking for someone who can say he's slated to direct and produce it."

"Jesus, Melissa, are we actually going to make this fake movie? I think I'll have the kids by the time we get started," Jennifer almost laughed. She paused when she realized it was the first time she had thought beyond the pregnancy and to the inevitable conclusion of it. Melissa didn't let up.

"We want it to sound real, okay? Just read this, I'll set up some details to fill in, and you can saunter up to Catt and take whatever she throws at you."

Jennifer took the script, impressed and touched. "Change 'saunter' to 'waddle' and you'll be right."

"Good. We have a few hours, so let's not waste them. Do you need anything?"

Jennifer's belly growled. She sighed, but smiled. Melissa returned the expression.

"Coming right up, honey."

"Honey?" Jennifer said to herself as Melissa rushed off to get more food.

112221221122111211.content:
Melissa spent the day wheeling and dealing to get this movie off the ground. Jennifer only had the vaguest notion of what she was doing, however. She spent the day planted on the sofa half watching TV while Melissa brought her food. She was exhausted and felt more lethargic than before. Sometimes, she could swear she could feel the skin of her belly stretching tighter whenever a flurry of kicks went through her.

Jennifer's maternity jeans feelt even tighter than they did yesterday and her flowing blouse safely covering up her belly, attempted to walk through the studio with as much grace that her lumbering frame would allow. She knew she didn't fully succeed. She had to keep resting her hands on the small of her back to ease the pain. She only wanted to sit down. But she put on a brave face, fully made-up and ready to be on camera when they arrived for the interview. She pretended to ignore the secretary's shocked look. She was very much larger than she was when she was here the other day, and there was no way to deny it.

Catt stopped in her tracks as she approached Jennifer, as unable to hide her surprise as Jennifer could her giant stomach.

"Oh my god, Jennifer," she said, approaching her, looking her whole body up and down, seeming to take in every change from her wider hips, swollen breasts, puffy face, and of course, that massive midsection that dominated her.

"Yes, I know, I'm very big," Jennifer said with a smile.

"And you're here to tell us you're not pregnant?" Catt said, bemused but friendly.

The two walked to the studio.

"I'll explain everything. But no, I'm not pregnant, believe it or not."

They took their positions by the chairs in front of the camera. Jennifer looked at hers and hesitated. She would barely fit in it.

"Can we, er, use the couch? I don't get along so well with chairs these days," she said with a faint chuckle.

"Oh, of course we can," Catt sprang up, Jennifer noted jealously how easy it was for her. She motioned to the crew to focus on the couch now.

Jennifer lowered herself into the couch. She would like to have sat up straighter, but the best she could manage was keeping her head high while her body sunk into the couch. She rubbed her stomach self-consciously, not even able to stop. She was much more mentally prepared than the other day, and she didn't dread being on film in her state as much as she would have thought.

"Okay, we go live in just a minute. Do you need anything, Jennifer?" Catt asked with a note of sincere concern in her voice.

"No, thank you, I'm fine."

"And here we go . . . Hello, I'm Catt Saddler and we are here one again with Jennifer Lawrence. She has been denying pregnancy rumors for days and she is here to to tell us the whole story."

Jennifer knew that at this point viewers would get the money shot of her massively bloated body.

"Hi, Catt, thanks so much for having me."

"The pleasure is all ours. Now, Jennifer, you've been denying these rumors, but you can't say they're not without good reason."

Jennifer shifted her heavy frame uncomfortably as she spoke.

"There is a good reason, Catt. I'm not the first actress to do this for a role. There's not a whole lot I can say since the production is under a lot of secrecy, but I can say that I am preparing for a role in a small, independent drama about a woman carrying octuplets."

"An octomom movie?" Catt asked.

"Well, the script has been floating around a while, but that whole incident made people lose interest. It's an original story, and when I read the script I felt a small movie like this was just the thing after the big budget Hunger Games films I've been spending the last few years doing."

"I imagine those can take a lot out of you."

"They can, but it's all worth it in the end. This is something completely different, though, and I wanted to dedicate myself to the fullest to do it."

"So what you're saying is you're pulling a De Niro and gaining weight for the role?"

"Yes, and thank you for the comparison."

"Nobody would deny that you're one of the brightest stars of your generation of actors. But, how are you able to gain weight to look pregnant? It seems pretty unusual that would only gain in your stomach."

Jennifer chuckled, but was starting to blush as the topic of her figure came up,"Catt, you've seen me from behind, you know this isn't the only place I've grown."

Catt returned the laugh. "Are you on a special diet?"

"I am, with strict doctor supervision. Much of this is water weight, although obviously I'm bigger elsewhere."

"Jennifer, after this nobody can question your dedication to your craft. It's just a little hard to believe that after getting into such fantastic shape for your last roles, you would do this to yourself for one small role."

"I understand most people would think that. But I really liked this script. And I understand more of what a woman in this condition is going through than I would have before. I have a lot more respect for mothers everywhere, I can tell you."

"Is it uncomfortable?"

"Extremely, but you get used to it. Of course, most pregnant women have a lot more time to adjust than I have."

"Do you think you will be able to get your old body back after the move is done?"

Jennifer frowned, suddenly depressed at the thought.

"I'm sure it will be a lot of hard work, but I'm no stranger to that. And it's for a project I really believe in. You have to sacrifice for your art sometimes, you know."

Catt nodded with approval, but there was still that questioning, suspicious look to her.

"Well, Jennifer, nobody would question your dedication. I have one more question-can I touch it?" she smirked as she said it.

Jennifer blushed bright red, finally stumbling in her words.

"Oh, uh, sure. I mean, I'll have to get used to it, right?"

She lifted up her shirt, revealing the taut, pale skin of her stomach and that knobby extrusion her belly button had become. She held her breath as Catt reached over and very gently rubbed her stomach. She did so for a moment, as if looking for something. Jennifer hoped it wouldn't happen, but the kicking started. Catt pulled back, squinting at Jennifer, and she had to think fast. With surprisingly little effort, she released quite a loud belch, covering her mouth with embarrassment. Jennifer couldn't tell if Catt bought it, but it looked like she at least accepted it for the time being.

"Sorry, the whole process leaves me kind of . . . gassy."

"Oh, it's all right. That's a lovely necklace by the way," Catt said. Jennifer looked down as she pulled her back down. The necklace had a faint glow. For some reason, she kept forgetting it was there. She ignored it entirely. Ever since she bought it just before . . .

The idea struck her that she bought it just before this whole thing started happening. She even had morning sickness after putting it on. How had this not occurred to her before? It almost had a few times, she knew, but something always pushed it out of her mind.

Catt was already wrapping up with Jennifer returned to her senses.

"We all look forward to seeing this movie, I'm sure. Are you sure there's nothing anything else you can tell us?"

"Sorry, Catt, I'm sworn to secrecy," she smiled. "You'll just have to wait like everyone else."

They both laughed, although Jennifer could tell that Catt wasn't fully buying the story. She turned to the camera.

"And I'm sure we'll all find out when it's released . . . when did you see it'd be coming out?"

"Er, that's a secret."

"Of course," Catt said. "Thank you for stopping by Jennifer."

"Thank you for having me, Catt."

They signed off. Jennifer couldn't get out fast enough. She was polite enough as Melissa heaved her out of the chair, but then she moved as fast as her belly would let her.

"What's wrong?" Melissa asked as they left the building.

"This is going to sound crazy. I think this necklace did this to me."

"What? That's crazy, how can a necklace make you magically pregnant?"

"How can anything make you magically pregnant? I think we need to look into this. I feel like it's, I don't know, been trying to get me to not look into it. I was freaking out the other day, we both were, but now it seems normal. How is that possible?"

Melissa considered this. Jennifer was right. They should both be far more concerned than they were.

"Okay. Where did you get it?"

-------------------------

"I don't buy it, Kevin," Catt said, sitting with her producer in his office.

"Hey, it's farfetched, but what else can you do? If it's not some crazy method acting stunt she's still not pregnant."

"! don't know, but there's a story here and I want to get to the bottom of it."

"Get to the bottom of it? Catt, you're a celebrity gossip host, not an investigative reporter."

"Don't you think Jennifer Lawrence trading in her perfect little figure for this giant hippo sized one in a matter of days isn't a huge story we should be investigating?"

"Hey, Catt, if you want to look into, be my guest. But I think you're thinking way too much of it. Remember all the time you wasted on Kelly Clarkson and then it turned out she just gains weight all the time?"

"There has to be more than she's letting on."

Kevin shrugged. There would be arguing with Catt on the point. She was going to find what was really going on with Jennifer.

Jennifer told Melissa about the mysterious antique store by her place, and how she had brought the necklace there after the old shop owner told her the story of how it belonged to a princess who was abandoned by her fiance and then committed suicide from the shame.

But before they were even halfway there, Jennifer had to stop and eat. This in itself had become quite a process. The two could no longer hop out of the car, grab a bite, and then be off. Instead, Jennifer's now hefty body had to be heaved out of the car with Melissa's help, and then slowly moved into the restaurant on her exhausted legs. Once in, they had to order a massive amount of food, and then Melissa had to sit by while Jennifer ate. She had become more adept at stuffing her face, but she wasn't a machine. Five super sized double quarter-pounder meals don't go down quickly.

"I can't believe-wuuuuuuurp!-excuse me, uh, I can't believe I'm still eating this much," Jennifer said, not even mentioning how delicious the greasy fast food was to her in her state. She placed her hands on the sides of her enormous belly, "I mean, I'm already this big, and this full, and yet somehow I can still get fuller."

Melissa smiled politely while she herself chowed down on the fries that Jennifer was missing. "I think it's starting to rub on off on me. Be careful, Jennifer. When this is over you don't want to have thrown your appetite so far off that you can't go back to how you were before."

"Don't even joke about that," Jennifer snapped, stuffing a burger in her face. She finished it in three bites. Her previous embarrassment at being seen like this in public was growing dimmer by the hour, much as the transformation her body was still going through had gone from being a terrifying nightmare to being a natural-seeming yet uncomfortable inconvenience.

It took an hour, and another order, before Jennifer's belly allowed them to leave.

"I already feel bigger," she said, as Melissa slowly helped her into the car, "These jeans are starting to chafe around my thighs. Uhg, I'm through with this."

"Where is the place? It's already 7:30, think we can make it before it closes?"

They were almost too late. They pulled up to the store nearby Jennifer's house and found the old shopkeeper closing up. They hurried as much as they could. He turned around and they could follow the line of his sight-from Jennifer's face, to her belly, to her necklace, and then her face again-and the wonder spreading across his face.

"Oh, miss, I, uh-" he stammered.

"Can we go inside to discuss this?" Jennifer said. Her feet were aching, her back was cramping, and she really needed to pee. These were constants with her now, but walking even a short while aggravated them.

"Yes, yes, yes," the man said, unlocking the door.

They went inside. He had already drawn the curtains, and locked the door behind them. He was shaking and nervous. Jennifer and Melissa couldn't tell from his reaction to them how much he knew or suspected. They waited for him to speak. He pulled a chair up across from them as they took a seat in a musty old couch.

"Ms. Lawrence-" he said.

"Oh, so you still recognize me then?" Jennifer said, growing angry with the man as he sat there. He had sold this to her, and now it looked like he suspected that it was magical and could do this to her. "I might have changed a little since I was last in here four days ago."

"Let me explain, I never meant anything like this to happen. This is, well, this is, as you can see, completely unprecedented. Nobody's every heard of such a, er, rapid pregnancy-"

"With eight babies," Melissa interjected.

"And I'm not even full term yet," Jennifer said. Melissa was remaining calm, but Jennifer finally had something tangible to pin her frustrations on, even if her mind was somehow forcing her to come to peace with her condition.

"Where did the necklace come from?" Melissa asked.

"A dealer from Europe sold it to me. I get a lot of my items that way. And some of them have been shown to be, well . . ."

"Magical?" Jennifer said, the word coming out more naturally than it would have days before.

"Er, yes, but normally it's in the good way. I've never had anyone come back with a complaint, and I assume when I sell something with good attributes I often won't hear anything at all about it, so I don't have anyway of knowing. If would have known something like this could happen I never would have sold it, I assure you!"

He seemed sincere, genuinely sorry, and that caused Jennifer to lighten up on him somewhat. Melissa took charge of the conversation at this point.

"Okay, so you know things like this were possible? Do you know if there's any way to reverse it?" She said it haltingly. Jennifer felt a strange kind of sadness at the thought as Melissa said. She was actually growing attached to the eight babies growing inside her now, and the idea of them vanishing gave her a sense of loss she knew wasn't natural for a supernatural pregnancy.

"I can and will look into it. But not in my knowledge. Things like this must have occurred, and it would take some research to see what happened in past cases."

"How much time? I only have a few more days before I give birth," Jennifer said. "And, if you haven't noticed, I'm not sure I can take getting that much bigger. I feel like I'll burst as it is."

"We can consult my own private library. The necklace was from a princess in the Baltic area, and I have several works dealing with arcane objects and curses from there."

"Then start reading. What do we do in the meantime?" Melissa asked.

"Oh" Jennifer started, grabbing her stomach. The babies were kicking up a storm again. Their movements across the surface of her belly were visible even through her shirt. It was minutes before they calmed down.

"Is there even anything we can do?" Melissa asked again.

This flustered the shopkeeper. He was an antiques dealer, not a wizard. That he had more knowledge of this kind of thing helped but he was certainly no expert.

"There might be somebody who can help you. Her name is Alice, lives on the other side of town. She's...interested in the arcane to say the least. Would you like me to give you her address?" the shopkeeper asked.

"I guess it wouldn't hurt." Jennifer said, rubbing her pregnant belly, which now was big enough to make her look nearly due with triplets.

"Very well, then. Here." he replied, handing her a small piece of paper with the address on it. Jennifer and Melissa thanked him, and were on their way. "If you find anything, will you let us know?" Melissa asked.

"Sure. Better yet, come back tomorrow and I might have something for you." the shopkeeper said. With that, the two left the shop and got in the car.

"So do you think this Alice will know anything about your...condition?" Melissa asked. "Condition? Come on, Melissa. I'm not sick. I'm just..." Jennifer trailed. "Rapidly pregnant with octuplets via a magical necklace?" Melissa finished.

"Well, when you put it like that..." Jennifer said, cracking a smile. She rolled up her shirt as she watched her many unborn children kick visibly. Melissa smiled, and stifled a giggle. "What's so funny?" Jennifer asked.

"Nothing, it's just...you're gonna get so huge!" she said. "Heh. Funny, I thought I already was huge." Jennifer replied. "Alright, even more huge." Melissa laughed, before starting the car, going to see Alicia.

Catt Sadler sauntered through the E! News office, looking to find answers. She approached Randy, one of their members of the paparazzi. "Hey, Randy, get any good pictures lately?" she asked, sitting on his desk. "Catt?!? Uh...not really. Just the usual." he said.

"Just curious. Have you taken any pictures of Jennifer Lawrence recently?" Catt asked. "Yeah. Why do you ask?" Randy asked. "No real reason. Just wanted to see some pictures of my friend, taken by our best photographer." she said, giving Randy a smile. He gulped nervously.

"Here's one taken today. I can give you the rest tomorrow." Randy said, handing her the picture. "Thanks, Randy. I owe you one." she said, giving Randy a wink.

Catt looked at the picture, and saw that it was Jennifer leaving some type of store with Melissa. "Oh, my goodness. Look at that big old belly!" she said, noticing Jennifer's globular tummy, not that it was hard to notice. "No way in hell she isn't pregnant..." Catt muttered to herself.

Twenty minutes later, Catt arrived at the store where Jennifer had purchased the necklace, and went inside. The shopkeeper noticed her, and approached her. "Sorry, ma'am, store's closed." he said. "Not so fast. We need to talk." Catt replied.

"About what? Jennifer Lawrence was here earlier today, correct? Blonde hair? Looks like she's about to give birth?" Catt asked, throwing in that diss. "Yes, why do you ask?" the shopkeeper inquired.

"Well, I want to know WHY she was here." Catt said. "Ah. A few days ago, she had bought a necklace, and she showed up earlier today simply to ask some questions about it. That's all." he said. "That's it? You're sure?" she asked.

"Yes. That's it. Now, I need to close shop for the night." he said, ushering Catt out. She was fairly satisfied, but felt like he had something to hide. "So she bought a necklace, and had some buyer's remorse? Interesting...very interesting." Catt cackled.
