" . . . let's just say some things fell through, mistakes were made, words were said. The important thing is, we need to get this thing shot fast-"

"Or look like you're getting it shot fast, from what I'm hearing," the voice on the speaker phone said with a chuckle.

"I didn't say that," Melissa said. "But we'll pay. And besides, you owe me. You would have been blacklisted even worse without my help, remember?"

"Yeah yeah, I remember. All right, send me the script and you can say I'm on it. It's kind of funny, though. Jennifer does all this work to make herself into some kind of human blimp and then the whole deal goes through in a day. Hey, but if anyone can salvage it, you can, Melissa!"

"I can hear you, Joel," Jennifer said. Although she actually did find his amusement more entertaining than offensive.

"Oh, um, hey there, Jen! You looked great in that interview today!"

"Okay, sending the script over now. Thanks a bunch," Melissa said.

"No problem at all!" Joel said. Melissa hung up and sent the script through her phone. This certainly was turning into a makeshift production. Melissa let the supposed director believe that they were trying to save a production that had fallen through to justify why this had to be done so fast, and he bought it without her even coming out and saying it.

"It's funny how used to hearing people say how big I am I'm getting," Jennifer said with her hands resting on the sides of her massive belly. It looked like it was pinning to her seat now, heavy, full, and round.

"Heh, a few days ago that would have really pissed both of us off."

"Hey, stop by that Wendy's, I need a burger . . . or five," Jennifer smiled bashfully. They did so despite Melissa's weak protest.

It was night by the time they reached Alice's. She lived in a sparsely-populated area just outside of the city. The place wasn't hard to find, although the driveway went through some woods before opening up onto a small cottage.

"Looks like a witch lives here," Jennifer said laughing. Melissa helped her out of the car. Jennifer felt the babies kicking again. She leaned against the car and rubbed her sides.

"What's wrong?"

"Uhg, this shirt, look. It's getting tight," she said, motioning towards how strained the fabric around her middle was getting. That morning it was loose enough, but now it looked like a few more pounds would rip it. Her belly button poked out up front, clearly visible even through the shirt.

"You're getting bigger," Melissa said.

Alice opened the door before they arrived. She was a pretty, older woman, probably in her late 50s, and greeted them warmly. She made no comment about how massive Jennifer Lawrence had gotten, and that made her okay in their book.

"Come on in. You must be Jennifer and Melissa. Sam said you'd be coming by tonight."

"Hi, you must be Alice," Melissa said, shaking her hand. Jennifer did the same.

"We really, really appreciate any help you can give us," Jennifer said. "But can I sit down, please?"

Alice ushered them into her quaint living room. Jennifer found a big recliner which she sunk into. It was as close to comfortable as she had been in days.

"I was wondering why Sam sounded so urgent, but now I see why. So, is that the necklace then?"

"Yes, we think it caused this. The other day I was normal, now I'm carrying eight in here," Jennifer said.

"Mmmm," Alice looked closely at the necklace. "May I?" Jennifer nodded. Alice took the necklace in her hands but did not remove it. "You seem very calm about this," she said as she examined the offending item.

"I know, we both are," Melissa said.

"Well, at first, I was completely freaked out. But, I don't know, it just feels more . . . normal now. I don't know how to explain it." She smiled, rubbing her belly.

"Mmm. Well," Alice let go of the necklace, "the necklace itself appears to be normal for its origin, but it obviously isn't. So we can rule out any kind of ancient evil or intentional curse."

Jennifer and Melissa were silent for a moment, then burst out laughing. Alice joined them.

"I will say this, it is so nice not to have to convince you I'm talking nonsense," Alice said. "May I . . . examine you?"

"Y-yeah, I guess," Jennifer blushed and lifted her shirt up. There were light flutterings all throughout her stomach, some visible on the surface. The skin looked tight, painfully tight, but to Jennifer it manifested more as a mild yet widespread discomfort. Alice ran her hands over Jennifer's belly for longer than she would have liked.

"And Sam tells me you're not full term yet, is that right?"

"Yes," Jennifer said, wishing Alice would stop rubbing her stomach.

"Well, they're human. And there are eight of them. But I can--and you'll pardon me if I don't go into too much detail--feel their life getting stronger. They're growing as we speak. You're growing as we speak," she added. Jennifer pulled her shirt back down.

"Well?" Melissa said. So far Alice hadn't told them anything useful. "What can you tell us?"

"Can I have them?" Jennifer asked. "I mean, can I, you know, give birth to them? Eight babies?"

"Eight full-sized babies," Alice said, "if my hunch is right. Do not quote me on this, but I think yes, you can. You're body is rapidly adapting to your condition. Whatever is in this necklace causing this I think that it means you to come to term and have eight healthy babies."

Jennifer breathed a sigh of relief. "So it won't kill me, then?"

"Right now, I don't think so. May I take the necklace, just for a moment?"

Jennifer couldn't answer, but nodded. Alice reached over and lifted it over Jennifer's head. Jennifer found that it took all her power to not try and stop her. Her heart even raced as she did so.

Alice held the necklace up. The three of them could clearly see a faint glow in it.

"Mmm, yes, yes, I can feel something inside this," Alice said.

"Ooooh, guys," Jennifer moaned. She began rubbing her stomach again. She felt the flutterings turn into kicks. Suddenly her belly seemed to be aching, almost painfully. It was as if all the weight, which she had been feeling of course, was now forcing itself on her even more.

"What's wrong?" Melissa jumped to her side.

"I-I don't know," Jennifer was sweating now. "But it hurts," she clutched at her belly. It was wobbling now, the kicks growing stronger. She winced in pain. She breathed deeply. It wasn't contractions she was feeling, but every change that had come on her hitting her at full force.

Alice hurried and put the necklace around Jennifer's neck. The feelings subsided, and Jennifer's belly returned to its calm, albeit rotund, state.

"Wow, what the hell was that?" Jennifer asked.

"Keep this on," Alice said, pointing to the necklace. "There is either a spirit or part of a spirit in there, and it's keeping you pregnant and able to be as pregnant as you are."

"How does that help us?" Melissa asked, frustrated.

"For starters it's good to know I'm not going to die from having too many babies," Jennifer said. "But, Alice, what do we do?"

Alice thought for a moment before answering.

"I don't believe that there's anything I can do for you. In a few days time, three to my estimates, you're going to give birth." Alice said. Jennifer and Melissa looked at one another. Now that she actually thought about it, the idea of giving birth to eight babies was not a pleasing one.

"So is that all that you can do for me?" Jennifer asked, rubbing her belly as her unborn kicked inside. "I'm afraid so. Just keep the necklace on, and the rest of the pregnancy will be stress-free." Alice said.

"Right. Well, thank you, Alice." Melissa said, helping Jennifer out of the recliner. The two left the house and got into the car. "So the necklace made you pregnant, and makes you and the babies healthy if you leave it on?" Melissa asked. "Seems like it. This thing's a gift and a curse." Jennifer said.

"We should probably get back to the house. The doctor said he'd be by tonight." Melissa said. Jennifer nodded, and they returned to Jennifer's house, where Dr. Anderson was waiting inside.

"I caught that interview a few hours ago. Method acting, huh? They seemed to buy it, though." the doctor noted as he began to examine Jennifer. "Yeah, we're actually going to start filming the movie tomorrow. Gotta keep the media believing that this pregnancy's fake." Melissa said.

"Well, this is definitely real. They're bigger than they were this morning." Dr. Anderson noted. "Really? How far along am I now?" Jennifer asked. "I'd say about 26, 27 weeks." the doctor said.

Jennifer nodded. "So when will I give birth?" she asked. "What's today, Thursday? I'd say Sunday at this rate." he replied. "They're healthy, right?" Melissa asked.

"Oh, they're perfect. It's incredible, really. I never thought that I'd live to see an octuplet pregnancy carried to term, but you're going to do it. It's a shame I can't tell anyone about this, though..." he noted.

"Just keep it under wraps for a few more days. Thank you, doctor." Melissa said, as Dr. Anderson promised to see them tomorrow. Jennifer then heaved herself off of the couch and headed towards the kitchen.

Jennifer scoured the kitchen for food, and had what she considered to be a snack. But at this point in her pregnancy, it was essentially just another meal. She devoured it in no time, and stood up and walked back into the living room. Jennifer could hear a ripping sound, and noticed that her shirt had ripped, her belly becoming too big for it.

"Ugh great. This was my biggest shirt, too." Jennifer noted. "Hey, if you've got it flaunt it, Jen!" Melissa giggled. "Oh, I've definitely got it, alright. There's no way I can wear the maternity jeans anymore, they're getting pretty tight. Guess it's just yoga pants and running tops from here on out." Jennifer said.

"You should probably get some sleep, Jen. Big day tomorrow." Melissa said. "You're right. Don't be too surprised if I wake up bigger tomorrow, okay?" Jennifer asked. "Trust me, that won't surprise me in the slightest." Melissa said.

Jennifer went to bed, eager to start filming the movie in the morning.

11222122112211121111121.content:
Jennifer didn't get as much sleep as she would have liked. The weight of the babies made her uncomfortable, and it took her a while to get in a position where she was fairly comfortable. Even when she was able to get comfortable and sleep for a small amount of time, she would have to wake up to pee due to the pressure that the babies constantly applied. Needless to say, it wasn't a great night for Jennifer.

The sunlight shining through the blinds in her room woke Jennifer up. She groaned, disappointed that she didn't get more sleep. She threw off her covers, getting a good look at her belly, which had grown overnight. She now looked due with quadruplets. Jennifer ran a hand over her globular tummy, feeling her babies kick.

She heaved herself up off of her bed after a few tries and waddled over to her closet. Jennifer pulled out a black pair of yoga pants and a bright blue running top. The yoga pants hugged her rear pretty tightly, showing how large it had become in the past few days.

Her running top could barely contain her breasts, and displayed her round pregnant belly, popped-out belly button and all. It wasn't the best look, but it was the only thing that fit her at this point in her pregnancy.

Jennifer walked downstairs, directed by the smell of food cooking in the kitchen, and was greeted by Melissa and Dr. Anderson once again. "Morning, Jen! Sleep well?" Melissa asked, preparing food on multiple plates.

"Eh, not really. I guess that comes with the territory of being pregnant with octuplets." Jennifer replied. "Sorry for stopping by so early again, but Melissa told me that you were starting to shoot the movie in a few hours, and I'm stacked for the rest of the day so this would be the only chance for me to examine you." Dr. Anderson said.

"That's fine, doctor. Just let me feed these babies real quick and I'll let you look at me." Jennifer said, taking a seat to dig in. She ate all of the food in impressive time, licking all of the plates clean.

She waddled over to the couch and stretched out, allowing the doctor to conduct the ultrasound. "Alright, so it appears that the babies are about thirty weeks along. All perfectly healthy." he said.

"That's good. Is there anything else?" Jennifer asked. "Well...because you're carrying this pregnancy so well, and because the babies are perfectly healthy, there might be a chance that you pass your due date." he said.

"What? So I might be overdue at some point?" Jennifer asked. "It's a possibility. A small one, but a possibility nonetheless. I'll stop by sometime tomorrow to get another examination. I'm going to be pretty busy, but if you have any questions or concerns give me a call and I might find some time." he said.

Melissa and Jennifer thanked Dr. Anderson, and he was on his way. Melissa and Jennifer followed suit, and were on their way to the movie set.

"They're kicking again. But, I don't know, it feels . . . bulgey," she winced. Melissa looked concerned. After a moment, the discomfort passed, and Jennifer asked if they could begin.

Lucy taught her the basics, and Jennifer felt clumsy doing them. She was convinced she must look like an awkward idiot the way she could barely change positions without help, and how after only a few deep breaths she became lightheaded. She knew that she had changed a lot in the last few days and was once again struck by just how much her body had gone through.

The class lasted an hour. Jennifer got the impression that Lucy wanted to go on further, but by then Jennifer's stomach growled so constantly that they all decided it was time she eat.

"I don't normally do this, but would you like me to be there tomorrow?"

"That would be great," Melissa said, seeing that Jennifer was too out of breath to answer. "I arranged for a private room in the hospital, away from where anybody might try to sneak in."

"She's amazing like that," Jennifer said. "Could you two help me up?"

They heaved Jennifer up. She tugged at her large shirt and frowned.

"I thought so," she said, and Melissa nodded knowingly.

"What?" Lucy asked.

Jennifer blushed as Melissa said, "She . . . grew some."

"What? Just now?"

"Over the last hour," Jennifer said, bits of worry reappearing in her mind, "It hasn't happened that fast in a couple of days, though."

They were interrupted by an enormous gurgling sound from Jennifer's belly.

"Okay, guys, I need food. Now."

"Thank you again, Lucy," Melissa said. Jennifer just nodded. She was too tired and hungry to say much more.

Once in the car, Jennifer turned to Melissa.

"And thank you," she said, "I really couldn't have gotten through this without you."

"Hey, you don't have to worry about it," Melissa said. She rubbed Jennifer's belly gently.
11222122112211121111121112111.title: Private birthing class

112221221122111211111211121111.content:
Jennifer and Melissa arrived home, as the pregnant actress was helped out of the car and into the house by her good friend. Jennifer waddled to the couch and sat down, the furniture giving an ominous creak in response.

"Alright, so since this is the last pregnant dinner for you, I thought I'd cook something up for you. What would you like?" Melissa asked. "Everything." Jennifer replied, her belly rumbling again.

As Melissa cooked, Jennifer watched TV. She noticed that every channel seemed to be discussing her pregnancy. Which was unsurprising, considering a famous actress being pregnant with octuplets isn't exactly an everyday occurrence. After about a thirty minute wait, Melissa had finished cooking.

Essentially, Melissa had cooked enough for an entire family, and then some. Jennifer thought that perhaps it was a little too much, but she was too hungry to not eat it all in a hurry. Somehow, Jennifer was able to eat it all, but definitely regretted it. "Eugh...that was a mistake..." she groaned, rubbing her belly.

"You've got to feed the babies, Jen. Oh, I think your belly got bigger..." Melissa trailed, placing a hand on her friend's constantly bulging and squirming pregnant belly.

"I think you're right. God, I can't wait for this to be over." Jennifer moaned, wincing at the odd sensation that she'd felt earlier. Melissa noticed her discomfort and approached her.

"What's wrong?" Melissa asked, looking noticeably concerned. "It's that same thing that happened during the birthing class." Jennifer replied. "Here, let me call the doctor." Melissa offered, dialing his number on her cell.

"Hey doc. It's Melissa. Jennifer's going through some discomfort right now, and we were wondering what was going on." Melissa said. She handed the phone to Jennifer to let her describe what was happening.

"So my belly's sort of getting...tight. After a while it goes away, but when the babies start to kick and get restless it tightens up. It's almost like I'm cramping or something." Jennifer said.

"Huh. Well, by my calculations you should be still in the eighth month of pregnancy, so you shouldn't be having contractions already. In all likelihood, you're experiencing Braxton Hicks contractions, which is essentially your body preparing for the real thing. I'll be with you two all day tomorrow, so I'll be able to help out some." said Dr. Anderson said.

The conversation ended, and Melissa helped the massively pregnant Jennifer to bed.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Across town, Catt was outside the antique store, observing the light that was on inside. The door was locked, but a nearby window was unlocked, as Catt carefully crawled through the window. As soon as she was fully inside, she was met by Sam, the store's owner.

"You again, what the hell are you doing here?" he asked. "Doing a follow-up. That necklace that Jennifer Lawrence bought. I want to know the truth. The necklace made her pregnant, didn't it?" Catt asked.

"What? N-no. Of course not." Sam said, trying to fool Catt. "Don't lie to me. If I find out you have, I'll have this store shut down faster than you can imagine." Catt said.

"It...it didn't make her pregnant. But...it did enhance it, so to say." Sam said. "Enhance? So that's why she's having octuplets?" Catt asked. "Yes. And it's why the pregnancy has progressed so fast." he replied.

"Huh. Interesting. Very interesting. Well, sir, I'm sorry that I had to sneak in uninvited, but I'm a reporter. And I had to get to the bottom of this story." Catt said. "It's fine. Just, please, don't come to this store anymore." Sam said.

"Sure thing. Not like this store will be open in a month, anyway." Catt scoffed, leaving the antique store.
112221221122111211111211121111.title: Jennifer goes home to prepare for the big day.

choices: Jennifer gets to the hospital, already in labor, but going smoothly
Labor isn't happening, Sam and Alice are needed
1122212211221112111112111211111.content:
With the excitement of what tomorrow would bring, Jennifer thought she'd have more trouble sleeping. Instead, she slept soundly for nearly twelve hours. It was almost afternoon by the time she woke up. She was used to waking up and having to assess the damage to her body, but today she saw that, against all reason, she was even bigger.

Her belly and tender, swollen breasts rose before her under the blanket. She didn't have to touch them to know how tight and sore they felt. The weight of them pressed her into the bed even more than before. She wobbled a little, and with some exertion found getting up was impossible.

"This is the big day, huh?" she removed the sheet and gently caressed her massive stomach. She had thankfully avoided too many stretch marks, and the ones that were there were barely noticeable. Inside her, she felt squirming and kicking the instant her hand met her skin. She winced. This was getting beyond uncomfortable. She pulled her hand back and grimaced at her fingers. They were definitely thicker than yesterday, as were her arms. She consoled herself that this was just last-day water weight, and that it wouldn't add to what she'd already have to lose after she gave birth. It was still disconcerting. Turning her head to the side she could make out her rounder face in the mirror across the room. Jennifer sighed.

But these thoughts of her figure were only a momentary distraction, oddly enough. She called for Melissa.

"'Morning, Jen. How are you feeling?" Melissa began the process of hoisting Jennifer out of bed.

"Like-ugh!" Jennifer was pulled into a sitting position, "Like a giant water balloon with legs."

"Want some breakfast?"

"Actually . . . no," Jennifer smiled, "Not wanting to stuff my face constantly is definitely a feeling I'm glad to have back."

"Can you, er, stand?"

"Not sure," Jennifer fidgeted. With Melissa's help, they got her to her feet. She could certainly feel the full weight of her belly threatening to pull her down, but as long as she spread her legs and moved carefully, she did move. Move like a zeppelin, she thought, seeing how wide she was looking in the mirror.

Her largest yoga pants and t-shirt still left much of her belly in plain view, but Jennifer didn't care anymore. Getting downstairs took fifteen minutes of careful plodding. She waddled to the couch and unceremoniously fell into it.

"Here's the plan. We're meeting Dr. Anderson and some specialists at the hospital. It'll be completely private. We'll try to sneak you in so nobody sees."

"Great."

"We don't know when the time is coming so we think it's best to get you there right away, okay?"

"Makes sense to me," Jennifer rubbed the sides of her belly, smiling a little at the heavy kicking going on inside. Then, she grabbed it harder and doubled forward as much as she could. "Oh, ooow . . ."

"What is it?" Melissa stood ready to jump into action.

"It's that feeling again, like my stomach is being pushed out and forced in at the same time."

"Look," Melissa pointed at the necklace. It let off an intermittent glow. "It hasn't done that in a while."

"Well, why is it doing it now?" Jennifer closed her eyes and leaned back. The feeling wasn't passing. It was coming in waves, each one stronger, like her belly was pulsating from within and trying to swell even more.

"It might be protecting you," Melissa suggested, "Remember what happened when you took it off? I think it's preparing you to give birth."

"Let's hope so. Shouldn't we have Alice or Sam there? What if something . . . magical happens?"

"That's a good point," Melissa slapped her forehead, "I'll give them a call and see if they can make it. But we have to go. Can you walk?"

"I can waddle if I take the effort," Jennifer smirked. Melissa helped her up. She was carrying a large bag, presumably full of the regular supplies one would take to a hospital. They drove off to meet Dr. Anderson at the hospital. The entire time Jennifer could feel the feelings in her stomach getting stronger. Were these contractions? They didn't hurt enough, she thought. Or was it something else?

--------------------------------------

Catt felt pretty good about herself. She trailed Dr. Anderson to the hospital early that morning without him even knowing. Of course, once she was inside she'd have to find the room Jennifer was being kept in. But that wouldn't be too hard. She imagined after sidelining the doctor before he probably wouldn't just lead her right there, whatever she might threaten. So she stayed outside in the back of the parking lot, thinking she should just go in and start looking around.

After a half hour of watching she saw an old car pull up. She recognized the antique store owner get out, but not the lady friend he was with. Of course he would be here. It was his crazy artifact that caused this whole thing apparently.

Catt saw her chance. She rushed behind them and sneaked in after them. Finding the room might be easier than she thought. This part of the hospital looked like it was more for storage and maybe a few offices, so there were plenty of corners to hide behind while trailing the two without having to worry about long, open hallways giving her away. Catt wasn't entirely sure what she'd do when she was there, but she knew being present for Jennifer Lawrence giving birth to eight babies that gestated in way less than the normal was a story she didn't want to miss out on.
1122212211221112111112111211111.title: Start of the big day

11222122112211121111121112111112.content:
Somehow, Melissa and Jennifer were able to sneak into one of the side entrances of the hospital undetected. Slowly but surely, they arrived in the birthing room after a twenty minute walk, which usually would have taken two minutes.

Inside, Dr. Anderson, Sam, Alice, and Lucy were waiting. "So...is...it going to take....all of you...to get me on...this bed?" Jennifer asked semi-jokingly, struggling to breathe after that walk. Indeed it did, and after a brief struggle they were able to get her onto the bed, as they all noticed that the bed appeared to slowly descend under Jennifer's excessive weight.

"Melissa texted me about what was going on. We came as soon as we could." Sam said, as Alice nodded beside him. "Right, well before we go any further I want to see how the babies are doing." said Dr. Anderson. He wheeled the ultrasound machine beside Jennifer and began the examination.

"Oh, shit..." was all the doctor could say. "WHAT???" asked the five other inhabitants in the room. "I...I figured that you'd be at 39 or 40 weeks, but...it appears that the babies are currently at 43 weeks. You're gestating faster than I anticipated." Dr. Anderson finished.

"Sounds about right. Melissa and I figured that I'd been growing more often lately. So I'm overdue?" Jennifer asked, soothing the parts of her belly that she could reach. If someone looked close enough, they could make out each baby moving individually across the skin of her stomach, a sight that looked extremely uncomfortable.

"Yes, and by a fair amount, at that. I'd like to attach this monitor to you to get the babies' vitals." he suggested, pulling out a monitor that Jennifer had seen woman in labor wear in the movies.

Dr, Anderson attempted to attach it to Jennifer's belly, but it was far too round and wide to do so. "Alright then. That won't work. They were fully healthy anyway." he said.

"So what's going on with me? Am I having contractions?" Jennifer asked. "I...don't know. It seems like your body is preparing for the birth, but something's preventing it. We can't give you a cesarean because we're afraid about the blood loss, so we'll have to wait until your body is ready." the doctor concluded.

Before Jennifer could react, she felt her belly surge forward by an inch. "ARGH!" she moaned in pain. "What...what just happened?" Lucy asked. "Looks like she had a growth spurt." Alice noted.

"Well...we need to figure out how to stop it. I...don't know...if I can get...any...bigger..."Jennifer said, her voice beginning to fade. Melissa approached her friend and started to rub her belly in an attempt to soothe her. She noticed the necklace as it glowed faintly.

"That's it! The necklace is preventing you from giving birth!" Melissa yelled. "So what does that mean?" Dr. Anderson asked. "We need to make it so the necklace will allow her to give birth. Sam, Alice, look through that book of yours and see if there's anything relating to it. Lucy, help Jennifer do some breathing exercises." Melissa demanded.

They all agreed, and began to do their tasks. Sam and Alice looked through the book, looking for something that would help. "Let's see. Freezes the pregnancy? Don't want that. Delays the birth? Already happening. Transfers the pregnancy? Interesting, but no thanks." they said.

As they continued to look, Jennifer's belly pushed forward by another inch and her babies grew more restless. Melissa couldn't stand to see her friend in such pain. "PLEASE...THINK...OF...SOMETHING..." Jennifer pleaded.

"We're trying!" Sam and Alice said. "Wait, why don't we just take the necklace off?" Dr. Anderson asked. The room went silent. "Didn't think of that." Sam said. "Good idea, really." Alice added.

Melissa grabbed the necklace and slowly removed it, preparing for what would happen next. Almost at once, a multitude of things happened to Jennifer.

Her belly slowly lowered, signalling that the babies were close to coming out. "Here it comes." said Lucy. Then, her monstrous stomach pushed forward another three inches. "Must have been pent-up growth." Sam said. Her belly started to contract. "Ooh, boy." said Alice. And finally, her water broke. "It's time!" Melissa shouted.

Jennifer screamed as her belly contracted wildly, the outlines of each baby easily visible. "Okay! I'm going to get the nurse! Lucy, keep her on that breathing exercise!" Dr. Anderson shouted as he exited the room, preparing to birth Jennifer Lawrence's eight babies.
11222122112211121111121112111112.title: Labor is looming

112221221122111211111211121111121.content:
Jennifer's belly heaved upward and then forward with enough force that if she wasn't so heavy it might have jolted her off the table. She screamed, and before she was finished it happened again. Instead of holding onto her belly, she gripped onto the railings, throwing her head back in pain. She had spread her legs and Lucy was preparing to receive the babies. Jennifer only had the slightest idea what was going on around here. Right now her entire world was her giant, pulsating belly.

"Oh, wow, you're dilated. Completely," Lucy said calmly. "They're coming, just keep calm, and breath easy."

"Just get them out of me!" Jennifer screamed at her as another contraction came. Her insides felt like they were being twisted in knots, and from the outside her belly bulged and pulsated unnaturally. The babies wanted to be born and did not want to waste any more time.

"Okay, remember your birthing class, just push-"

"Ooooaaaah!" Jennifer thrashed on her bed as much as her bulk would let her. She felt her belly contract longer, harder this time, the movement was fierce and violent inside her. She had gotten used to the increasing discomfort but did not think she could handle this much pain.

"The first one is coming, we have a head," she heard Lucy say. Three nurses entered, preparing to take the babies for immediate care. They were all surprised to see how well-developed they were for newborns, nothing like the premature infants they expected even though Dr. Anderson had explained the situation to them.

With another forced push the first baby was born. Jennifer whimpered with relief.

"That's one!" Melissa shouted happily, "Only seven more to go, Jen!"

"I can count, Melissa!" Jennifer snapped as her belly, now a little lower than before, was seized by another spasm. "Oooh, god, not again . . ."

"You can do it, Jen, just breath, and push."

"You don't have to push so fast, Jennifer, take time," Lucy said as the second baby immediately came after the first.

"I'm not, it's doing it on its own," Jennifer said before devolving in a pained groan, growing too exhausted to do much else now. Her grip on the bars lessened, allowing her body to rock more back and forth with each contraction. Through her dim vision she saw the nurses take another infant.

"Two?" Jennifer asked.

"Here comes three," Lucy said. By now Dr. Anderson had returned to stand by. He stared wide eyed at the third already coming, and at Jennifer's massive, convulsing belly.

"And now four," Lucy said. Jennifer looked up, although she couldn't see past her breasts and smaller, but still gargantuan belly.

"Wha-? But-ooooh, again, it's happening again," Jennifer's eyes clenched shut as she let the contraction come over her again, her belly bulging this way and that, the kicks still there amid all the tumult. This time, she could actually see it shrink. She was halfway there, and could even see Lucy past her belly now. Dr. Anderson's look of astonishment did not give her confidence, but she was distracted as her entire stomach once again tightened and squeezed downward.

She could feel Melissa holding her hand now, and looked toward her friend.

"Halfway there, Jen," Melissa said. "Just keep breathing."

Jennifer tried to smile, "I-I can feel the next one, ooooooh god . . ."

The nurses couldn't take the babies fast enough. In rapid succession came five, and then six.

"Each one a perfect birth," she heard Dr. Anderson say. That at least was good news. But it didn't make it hurt any less.

Jennifer wanted to pass out now. She lay limply on the bad, her legs only remaining upright by the stirrups, and her hand by Melissa. She looked with tired, pained eyes at Melissa.

"I just want to sleep," she said quietly, before her face contorted in pain as the seventh was forced out of her.

"Just one more, Jen, just one more," Melissa said. She wasn't sure Jennifer could handle even one more, though. She had never seen anyone look as exhausted as she did and still be awake. Her whole body was drenched in sweat, and the only muscles that seemed to be moving were in her belly. Jennifer then saw her belly again. It was small enough now that she could see across the room, seeing where the newborns were being kept and cared for. With that, she let her head fall back as her body took control one last time. This time, when the eight was born, Jennifer could only give a tired groan.

"You did it, Jen!" Melissa said.

"Are . . . they healthy . . .?" Jennifer asked with the last of her strength.

"Amazing," Dr. Anderson said.

"Not one them needs any extra care of any kind," Lucy said. "This is the most amazing multiple pregnancy I've ever seen."

But Jennifer had passed out with a smile while they still talked. She was glad to hear it, and she'd be glad to meet her eight babies, and to appreciate getting something like her old body back, but she had no control over it now. She just had to sleep.

----------------------------

Catt had found the room with little trouble. It was in an isolated area of the hospital, but it was also the only place she saw a few nurses heading, and then Dr. Anderson. She was outside during the entire birth. She thought it would take a lot longer, that she might have time to step in during a lull and have a few words with the new mother. But it was so fast! And sounded unpleasant. She got the idea that maybe, despite her treatment of Jennifer, she might be able to get an interview with her about her unexpected motherhood. It was a tough choice to interview now in the heat of the moment or to hold off for what could be great on-air time later.

Reluctantly, she went with the latter. So she waited in the dark hallway while the babies were taking out. She felt just the slightest bit of happiness for Jennifer for them, she wasn't completely inhuman after all, but mostly she thought about how to get Jennifer to agree for more coverage later. The last big name to have eight babies was only famous for that. This would be a much different, and better, story. The last people to leave were Sam and Alice, the antique dealer and his weird friend.

"Ahem," Melissa said and stood up after everyone else had walked down the hallway, leaving Jennifer and Melissa alone.

"You," Sam said, "Do you have any sense of decency at all? Seriously, spying on a pregnant woman and then intruding on her like this?"

"Relax, pops, I'm not going to bother her. I have a question, though."

"What is it?"

"Was all that really . . . normal?" Catt asked, finding out she didn't really know how to phrase the question.

"Normal? There's certainly nothing abnormal about a new mother wanting to rest after giving birth."

"To eight babies? That she wasn't even going to have a week ago? Involving some necklace you say is magical?"

Sam shrugged. Alice tapped him from behind.

"Let's go, Sam."

"I don't know you what to tell you, miss," Sam said. "But I suggest you let the matter drop. She's alive, and the babies are alive, and they'll be healthy. That should be enough, even for you."

"Mm," Catt nodded as the two left. Catt resisted one last urge to burst in on Jennifer, and then turned and left.
112221221122111211111211121111121.title: The eight labors of Jennifer Lawrence

1122212211221112111112111211111211.content:
A few days later, Jennifer Lawrence was back home after the miraculous birth of her eight babies. She was resting on the couch, while two babies were latched onto her breasts. The other six were in their cribs a few feet away, as Melissa was attending to them.

"Jen, I've known this for a while, but you're officially my hero." Melissa said, patting her friend's shoulder. "Ha, I kinda feel the same about you. I mean, you're pretty much the only reason this pregnancy went smoothly." Jennifer said.

Jennifer had basically been away from all forms of outside contact since she gave birth, so she decided to turn on the TV. On E! News, she wasn't surprised to see a familiar face.

Catt was on the air, and as expected, was discussing Jennifer's pregnancy and birth. "She's so strong and so inspirational for going through this experience, especially in the public eye. I only wish that I was half as strong as her if I ever became a mother." Catt said, giving a fake smile to the camera.

Jennifer placed the babies down and stood up, heading over to approach the other six babies that needed attention. As she walked, Jennifer kept her hand on her stomach. It wasn't flat just yet, but it was definitely getting there.

As she tended to her children, Jennifer noticed that Melissa had a strange look on her face, as if she was severely confused. "Something wrong?" Jennifer asked. "Yeah...what happened to the necklace?" Melissa asked.

"Don't worry. It's in good hands." Jennifer said, turning to look at the TV.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

"Aaand cut! Alright, let's take a lunch break and then we'll be back to discuss breaking news. We'll start up in an hour!" said Kevin, the producer at E! News.

The cameras stopped rolling and the set lights dimmed, and Catt Sadler walked off the set. As she was walking to her dressing room, she was approached by an intern.

"M-ms. Sadler? I don't want to interrupt you, but...I've got a package for you." she said, handing her a small box. "Uh...thanks, I guess." she said, snatching the box from the intern.

Catt walked to the dressing room and slammed the door behind her. She opened the box, curious to see what was inside. To her surprise, it was a necklace. Or, to be more exact, the necklace that Jennifer had been wearing. Alongside it was a handwritten note. It read:

Catt,

Thank you so much for giving my new movie so much publicity. I'd also like to thank you for the kind words you had for me on today's show.

Thanks,

Jennifer

Catt put the note down and picked up the necklace. "This thing...I know what it did to Jennifer, but...that guy said that she was already pregnant..." she trailed.

Catt took a second to think. "I'd better not risk it..." Catt said, putting the necklace back in the box. She walked to the door, but paused as she was about to leave.

"You know what? It'll look good on me. I'm not pregnant, so I'll be fine." Catt said, returning to the piece of jewelry. She carefully placed it around her neck and got a look of herself in the mirror.

"Not bad at all. I think I'll keep this on for a while." she said. Suddenly, her stomach rumbled, much to Catt's surprise.

"Funny. Usually I'm not this hungry during lunch." Catt muttered. She exited the dressing room and headed to the cafeteria, unaware of the faint glow the necklace was emitting.
1122212211221112111112111211111211.title: Epilogue

choices: Follow the further adventure's of Catt's first day pregnant
11222122112211121111121112111112111.content:
The E! cafeteria, while it was a cafeteria in layout, offered more quantity and quality than what would normally be associated with the word. That day, Catt took full advantage of it. She didn't usually do that. When she did eat at the cafeteria, it was usually just a salad, or some other minimalist meal. She more often went out, or skipped lunch altogether. Catt was normally a very light eater despite her constant activity. Maybe that was why she received some raised eyebrows as she made her way through the line, her phone crammed between her ear and shoulder, and shoveling food on her tray. Between the three thick gyros, the plate of spaghetti, and two good sized pieces of cake for desert, she went to her seat with the tray flowing over.

Those around her may have thought it odd, but Catt didn't. She was famished. Her stomach started growling earlier and had only gotten worse. And for Catt, who's tiny appetite had done most of the work in keeping her so thin her whole life, when you were hungry you ate, and she was hungry. She sat down, and immediately dug in on the gyros, finally hanging up her phone.

She had gotten the first gyro into her eager stomach when Anna showed up out of nowhere with her camera in tow.

"Hey, Catt," Anna said, sitting down without ceremony. Anna was probably the closest thing Catt had to a friend, and it was not out of the ordinary for her to show up at her work sometimes.

"Hey," Catt said between bites, finishing off her first course. The grabbed the second gyro, unable to get it down fast enough. Her stomach still hungered for more, and even Catt, for all her lack of self-awareness, did realize that she was feeling full enough from the one that a second was unnecessary.

Still, she was hungry. Anna gave her a look.

"What?" Catt said, swallowing. "You have something for me?"

"Yeeeah . . . that's why I'm here. Check this out," Anna showed the screen on her camera to Catt, flipping through some pictures. Catt recognized the antique store where Jennifer Lawrence had bought the necklace that she now wore immediately. She also recognized Jennifer.

"Huh," Catt said, shoving as much of the second gyro in her mouth as she could, picking up the third and, with a few burps, started in on that, too. "She looks good for somebody who just had eight babies."

"Sure does. Must have some kind of Hollywood type trainer," Anna said.

"Yeah, well, her ass is still," Catt opened her mouth wider than Anna thought possible to shove the last of the third gyro in there. After seconds of chewing, she swallowed, burped with a full mouth, and patted her stomach. Anna now noticed the gurgling sound coming from it. If Catt looked as stuffed as she must surely be here flowing dress and thick belt were hiding it. "Enormous," Catt finally finished, taking up a fork to dig into the pasta. Catt sniffed it first, rubbing her stomach. "Mmmm, this smells wonderful. Go get yourself some, on me."

"Er, no thanks, I'm good," Anna said.

"Why were you hanging around the antique store? That story's done."

"I was in the area and just happened to see her. I thought you might be interested in Jennifer still going there."

"A little," Catt admitted, "But, you know what-urp-sorry, I'm over it. Jennifer getting huge, pregnant, lying about it, all that. It was a great story, but that was weeks ago. Maybe if she ever loses the baby weight we can have her on the show and talk about that, but until then I'll keep an eye out for something new."

Like notoriously skinny Catt Sadler eats entire cafeteria? Anna wanted to say. Catt leaned over the plate, eating the spaghetti in a series of fluid motions. Anna thought she looked like a cartoon character. She had eaten with Catt hundreds of times and had never seen her eat anything like this.

"What? You're looking at me weird," Catt stopped eating to ask, but only for a moment, and even then her cheeks still puffed out with food.

"Oh, just, uh . . . that dress looks really good on you," Anna said. No sense in getting Catt annoyed or upset. Anna knew her well enough to know that Catt responded to any perceived criticism with either denial or anger, and both were frustrating to deal with.

"I know, doesn't it?" Catt said, "Belt's a little snug, though."

Anna smiled knowingly at that. With no break at all, Catt went from pasta to cake, which she demolished as if she hadn't been stuffing her face for the last ten minutes. Finally, as Anna looked on in a mix of awe and amusement, Catt finished. She sat back and rested her hands on her tummy, its fullness hidden by her thick belt and loose dress.

"Oooh, good food," she said. "Hey, you think any other celebrities go to that antique store?"

"I don't know, I didn't hang around there to look. Maybe? It's in the right area."

"Mm, could be worth a look. But I need to . . . oh," Catt stood up with a little grunt, holding her stomach. "I . . . I don't feel so good . . ."

Catt looked nauseous, her face turning a shade of green while she held her stomach and sat back down. She looked at the empty tray, barely any crumbs even left.

"Did you let me eat all that?" Catt said.

"Let you?"

Catt chuckled, but still looked very nauseous. Her full stomach, and she now finally did feel that she was, in fact, very, very stuffed, churned uncomfortably. It'll pass, she thought, trying to put it out of her mind.

The receptionist approached and opened the door a crack.

"Did you have an appointment? This office is closed, you'll have to come back tomorrow."

"This is an emergency," Catt said. "Now let me go and see Dr. Anderson."

But the young girl wouldn't budge. "Not without an appointment."

Behind her, Dr. Anderson walked from one door into another, looking at some papers. He stopped when he saw Catt, his eyes bugging out when he saw her belly, and again when he saw the necklace.

"Dr. Anderson," Catt said, gently rubbing her belly.

"Let her in, Molly," he said, approaching the door. "So . . . Catt, could you, uh, step into that room and I'll see you in a minute?"

"Certainly," Catt gave the receptionist a snide look, and then ruined her proud walk past her by banging her hip into a desk. They must have gotten wider than she thought, she realized. She had been ignoring how tight her jeans were feeling all day.

She sat on the table in the office for only a moment before Dr. Anderson came in. In that short time alone she was able to take stock of her figure again. Her shirt had certainly grown tighter since earlier. Her belly, as much as she tried to deny it, was pushing out beyond her breasts now, unmistakable pregnant and very round. Dr. Anderson closed the door behind him. He looked her up and down, and sighed.

"Why would you put it on?" he asked, barely concealing a smile.

Catt couldn't help but laugh a little, "That's a very good question. Can we get to the point? You were with Jennifer through this same thing, right?"

"Most of it, yes. When did it start? Four days ago?"

Catt started to get nervous again, "No, uh, yesterday."

Dr. Anderson approached Catt.

"Lift up your shirt please."

Reluctantly, Catt did so. She gasped when she saw her bare belly for the first time since that morning. Light red marks were appearing along her sides. Her belly button was inverted already. The doctor felt around her belly.

"Mmm. We'll need an ultrasound."

"Sure," Catt said, lying down. In a few minutes, the machine was set up, Catt's belly covered in gunk, and Dr. Anderson moving the probe across her stomach, which she was sad to say was still moaning with hunger.

"Huh," Dr. Anderson.

"Don't tell me. Eight babies, too?" Catt said, her voice nervous.

Dr. Anderson finished the reading. He turned around and sat next to Catt. She propped herself up on her elbows with more difficulty than she was used to.

"I'm not sure how to tell you this, but it looks like you're carrying sixteen," Dr. Anderson said. To his surprise, Catt didn't seem to comprehend this.

"Sorry, what? I thought you said sixteen," she sat up, swinging her legs aside and pulling her shirt down.

"I did. Sixteen babies, and you are at nearly three months along."

"Don't be ridiculous," Catt said, taking a superior tone, "If I was carrying sixteen babies, can you imagine how big I'd get? I wouldn't be able to even walk by, like the fourth month, right? And by the end I wouldn't be able to move at all. It's impossible."

"I would have said Jennifer carrying eight babies to term was unlikely, too, but it happened."

"Yeah, but she got huge by the end," Catt said with a light chuckle. There was silence as she slowly started to get what the doctor was telling her.

"Sixteen?" she asked, her voice shaking a little.

"Yes, I'm afraid so."

Catt's eye twitched. She sat her hands on her belly, smoothing out her shirt which no longer looked as elegant on her. She breathed deeply, wondering exactly when she would start to panic. Sixteen babies? And she wasn't even a fourth of the way through, and already looked ready to pop as far as she was concerned? It was too much. She knew she should panic, and in the back of her mind she was, but openly, she remained unnervingly calm even if her her hands were shaking. She got off the table.

"Thank you, Doctor."

"Catt, if you'd like, I can monitor you, just come by any time you think there's something wrong."

"Something wrong? Like being pregnant with sixteen babies?" Catt let out a loud, forced laugh, which seemed to frighten the doctor.

"Er, yes, anything at all."

"Thanks," Catt said as she went to leave, "I'll do that."

"Are you okay?" Dr. Anderson said, wondering how close to a break down Catt must be to be acting so nonchalant.

Catt thought about it. She looked down past her swollen breasts to that giant, growling tummy. She shrugged at him, and left. She moved as fast as she could back to her car, as fast as her overly tight jeans, overly heavy belly, and chafing thighs would let her. Around her neck, the necklace glowed brightly. With a powerful force of will, Catt decided that it was simply impossible to be carrying sixteen babies, and that Dr. Anderson must be wrong. What does he know about mystical pregnancies anyways? And she had all of tomorrow off to sort this out.

Catt's third day magically pregnant and carrying sixteen went by in a blur. She stumbled around her house, eating, resting, sleeping, watching TV without even paying attention. Around noon she noticed the first hints of fluttering inside her. By evening, she realized she could no longer walk like she always had, and was now waddling. She spent the whole day in a depressed stupor, accomplishing nothing and ignoring what few calls she got.

And day four began with her waking up with a start. It was a start, because she tried to sit up and couldn't. Her giant, taut belly loomed above her, far eclipsing her painfully swollen breasts. The t-shirt she slept in was starting to tear around the seams. With effort, she heaved herself into a siting position on her bed. She rubbed the giant ball her belly had become, and sighed.

Slowly, Catt stood up, wobbling and nearly falling with every step. As she wiped the crust from her eyes she passed her bathroom mirror and stopped. She backed into the wall, shaking her head in disbelief. The face staring back at her was not hers. It was practically round, with swollen cheeks like she had the mumps, and a prominent double chin. She recalled what she had said to Jennifer.

"Pregnancy doesn't excuse the double chin."

The rest of her body didn't fare much better, but she found the loss of her lovely face more devastating. Even more than the previous day Catt wanted to crawl into a dark room and hide until it was all over. She managed to move her hands to her giant belly, so large now that she was just able to get her hands around it, and her fingers couldn't touch. The skin was tight, stretched, and tender. Every little movement inside her caused her to wince. And she could even see ripples of kicks move across her belly. It felt like aliens inside her trying to get out. And the more this freaked her out, the more they moved, until she was pressed into the wall, unable to look away from the image of bloated, gyrating belly before her.

"Stop, just stop," she said out loud. If the words didn't calm the movements within, the rubbing did. But even if only two or three were moving, it caught her off balance, causing her wobbling walk to be even more awkward. "Thankfully," her hips and legs had thickened considerably to help carry the load. She found this a small comfort, especially given her ass would have an embarrassment to even the fattest-assed celebrities she had mocked in the past. She must be at least as big as Jennifer Lawrence was at the end, and Catt wasn't even halfway through yet.

Catt managed, with much struggling, to get on some stretch pants and a tank top which left most of her belly in view. She couldn't go out like this. Maybe Megan Fox or Mila Kunis could show a little pregnant belly in public, but neither of them were remotely as huge as Catt was. She was fully aware of her situation again, but her trademark determination still needed an excuse to return.

She went to make some breakfast. Cooking proved absurdly difficult. With her belly in the way, she couldn't quite reach the stove. She strained her arms cooking up some bacon, eggs, and toast, and then once she did eat them she only wanted more. She saw her laptop. She hadn't looked at it since the day before when she got the news of how many she was carrying. She hadn't gone that long without using the internet since it was invented.

"Oh, what the hell," she muttered. The first thing that came up was a celebrity news site she often checked. It was unpolished and mostly images, but she had gotten some good scoops there before that she turned into full stories. She kept having to press her belly gently to sooth the movements inside. The necklace glowed softly, serving to calm her mind even if it couldn't remove all her unease.

As Catt scrolled down, she gasped. There were images of her. From the other day, back when she thought she was huge. Now, she thought back then she actually looked pretty good with a somewhat pregnant stomach. Nothing like the behemoth she had become in the last two days. They were shot while she was interviewing Kelly Clarkson, who despite no longer being pregnant still looked tiny compared to Catt's current form. But it wasn't the pictures that got Catt's blood boiling, it was the comments. Particularly a few which expressed that, after what she did to Jennifer, she deserved to get so big she'd never be thin again. The repetition of "never be thin again" repeated next to her name struck a nerve with Catt almost as much as her argument with Kevin two days before, where he repeatedly called her fat despite her being only a little pregnant then.

Catt struggled to her feet.

"Idiots!" she yelled at the laptop screen, then almost knocked the table over trying not to fall down as her belly forced her forward. Catt couldn't believe she wasted an entire day feeling sorry for herself. She could have spent it doing her job, for one thing, even if she was huge and growing by the minute. She could have spent it trying to reverse this. Instead, she wasted a whole day and now was so big she could hardly move. By tomorrow she might not be able to stand. And tonight she was scheduled to do one of her favorite things of all, an award show. It was all the best parts of interviewing celebrities without having to spend much time with them. Sure, her other favorite part of those was turning heads and looking sexy, but maybe Catt could settle for turning heads by being unrealistically pregnant instead. It might no be ideal, but then neither was going into hiding. Jennifer Lawrence did a nude scene when she was as big as Catt was now, and here Catt was too embarrassed to go out in public. No, none of that would do. Catt could have thought of a million ways it could go wrong, but they were all worse than just giving up.

Catt's mission to get back to work met with some immediate problems. Showering proved to be difficult, even dangerous. Doing her make up became a chore as her belly blocked her from leaning any closer to the mirror, and even if she could have she would have lost balance. Then there was the issues of clothes. Absolutely nothing she owned fit her in any decent way. She bit the bullet and went to a maternity store. She made a valiant attempt to get into her car and was nearly reduced back to her sullen inactive state by her inability to fit behind the wheel. So she called a cab, a fancy one. Once at the store, she was not surprised by how her size shocked everyone there. Had she not been so intent on hurrying up and going to see Kevin she would have berated half the store for constantly touching her stomach. It was like they were pathological drawn to it much as she couldn't stop rubbing it herself.

Then there was the constant kicking. There was always at least one, sometimes two. If more than four were moving she could barely stand. Mentally she was no longer disturbed by this, to her own surprise, but physically it was taking a toll on her. Several times while trying things on she had to sit down and patiently wait for the massive waves moving across her belly to settle.

And she insisted on jeans, the largest they had, along with the dress she planned to wear that night. She considered it a matter of pride.

"Mm," she said, struggling to turn to see her ass in the mirror, "Nope. Still doesn't look good in these." But she could at least laugh at herself as long as she didn't dwell on what would happen after she gives birth.

Refusing to get frustrated, Catt finally arrived at the studio by early afternoon. She did not want to be seen, but also did not want to look like she didn't want to be seen. She walked the halls past the studio, avoiding the astonished stares of her coworkers and ignoring the inevitable comments about how big she was. By the time she got to Kevin's office, she rested a moment. Her legs and back ached, and her feet were nearly numb. She had to catch her breath. Catt couldn't believe how much difficult it was to move her once slim, sleek body. Of course, it was neither slim nor sleek anymore. Finally she entered without knocking.

"Hello, Kevin," she said.

"Wha-Catt?" Kevin stood up from his work, "What are you doing here? I told you to take it easy."

Catt found the gentle and uncharacteristic tone flattering but she didn't wan tto be handled like an overemotional actor today.

"I wanted to get back to work," she said. She attempted to sway her hips, and couldn't, almost tripping.

Kevin couldn't take his eyes off her stomach. "Are you sure you should be, you know, walking?"

"Please, Kevin, don't worry about me. I'm just as--oooh--" Catt stumbled and grabbed her belly. Kicking again. She felt the fluttering on her left side, then it cascaded all through her stomach. In seconds, she was caressing her belly up and down through her giant maternity shirt trying to get them to calm, while she stumbled backwards ready to fall.

Kevin pushed a chair towards her.

"No, I'm fine," Catt snapped, still trying to sooth her stomach. Through her shirt she could see the movements looked as strong as they felt. She sat down, unable to take it anymore.

Kevin leaned on the front of his desk. "I don't think you should go to the Mini-Emmies tonight."

"I think I should," Catt said, wishing she could cross her legs and look thoughtful rather than just tired. "Why shouldn't I?"

"Well, since you seem to be in a much better mood, and I mean this with no intended insult, but don't . . . "

Catt cocked her head at him and narrowed her eyes.

" . . . think you'd look, ah, comparable next to the actors and actresses there?"

Catt's eye twitched but she kept her cool. "What do you mean, Kevin? Pregnant women have gone to award shows before."

"Not as pregnant as you," Kevin laughed. "Catt, if you go stand around trying to interview all those celebrities, you're going to see the footage later and hate yourself for it, and me for letting you do it."

"I can handle it. You know I have a way with these people anyways. Is there anyone else you'd rather send?"

"You can barely stand, Catt!"

Catt winced and rubbed her belly. The movements had died down somewhat, but she was feeling that horrible stinging, stretching feeling, spread across the entire vast dome of her belly.

"I can still stand, and walk, and talk, and I deserve to go at that show."

"Okay, I'm trying to be nice, but you know, this is Hollywood and we're a, ah, superficial people. I don't know what's up with this pregnancy, but you look like you've gained more than the average weight. You want to go on TV, hanging out with beautiful people, looking like you do right now?"

Catt was actually insulted. Not only because it wasn't her fault this was happening to her, but also because she had made the same point unsuccessfully several times earlier in her career to sideline the competition. Some of these points had even been made to Kevin himself.

"I don't care, I'm doing it and I'd like to see you stop me," Catt said. She tried to stand, but the chair rolled back. She tried again.

"Uh, here, let me--"

"No, just stand behind and push-"

"Like this?"

Finally, Catt stood, almost overshooting and falling over on her belly. Kevin nodded slowly.

"Okay, Catt. I'll let you try. But if you start feeling faint or like you can't handle it and I'll get Maria to step in for you. She doesn't like to do these smaller award shows but she'll do it if I ask."

"Menounos!" Catt said under her breath. The two did not cross paths often and Catt had forgotten that they had apparently mutually decided to be rivals. Catt shuddered now remembering how she "jokingly" ribbed Maria after feeling pictures her young, chunky self before she got into shape. Even now she almost rebutted Kevin's suggestion by making a disparaging comment about her ass.

"Fine. Deal!" Catt said, grabbing Kevin's hand to shake it. He took it. She saw his other hand lifting, possibly of its own accord, and head for her belly."

"Don't even think about it," Catt said, and waddled out of the room with back arched uncomfortably and head held high.

Before anything else, Catt had to eat something. In the cafeteria she ignored the gawking stares of her coworkers, as she was getting far too used to doing, and slowly sat down to eat an entire tray filled with every entree they had. She ate as fast as she could, but with her belly forcing her to sit so far from the table she had to be careful to avoid dropping anything on her. She was mostly successful.

Feeling only somewhat full, enough so that the movements had lessened enough for her to stand upright if unstably, she went to change. This required the help of her make up team, who politely made no comments about how massive she had become. The dress would have looked beautiful on her if she had had her old figure, but she thought it looked nice enough. It left her shoulders and neckline bare, minimizing her swollen breasts, and then draped loosely over her belly. She thought it might be snug around her hips and ass, but then what wouldn't be at her size? By this point, she had to force herself to accept it and move forward.

She asked her make up person if there was anyway they could make her face look less bloated. They tried, at least. It was nice to sit down for a while, though. The time was approaching, and Catt had to get in another large meal before heading out.

"Remember. You start feeling not up to it, Maria will step in," Kevin said. He appeared to be unaware of Catt and Maria's rivalry. They rarely crossed paths, and even to herself Catt admitted that it was mostly manufactured. They just plain didn't like each other and were in the same business, and since they were forced to work together on occasion had mutually decided to dislike the other. In normal times, Catt would not have been bothered so much by the threat of being replaced by Maria. She thought that Maria was a beautiful woman, sure, but to Catt she was to toned, too curvy, which now were complaints she thought sounded idiotic when she repeated them to herself. She thought they were essentially on equal terms in all areas, and that Catt just had more experience doing actual celebrity reporting and interviewing, so she had the edge. It felt strange, and uncomfortably humiliating, thinking that if they were together right now Maria would be "the hot one."

The camera crew stayed close, as was normal, although Catt could sense some kind of protectiveness in them. She wobbled as she walked, which was normal now, and whenever she overstepped the ones closest to her would make a quick move as if to catch her. She thought it almost sweet, but more annoying. She didn't need help she didn't ask for.

Other reporters like her were there as the stars arrived, sometimes one at a time, sometimes in groups. Catt's feet and back already ached by the time the first showed up. She had to look at the typical Hollywood splendor around her to remind herself to act normal and chat it up with everyone who came by. Some who knew her came right to her. She had to get used to nearly everybody touching her stomach, too. Nobody was outright asking her about it, but a few told her flat out that she was huge. She ignored it, asking the typical questions of if they thought they'd win anything, who had the best chances, or if they were only there as guests, whose guests were they?

It all seemed completely normal for an award show, the only difference being that she didn't walk up to anybody and just had to wait for them to come to her. This was partly because she felt horribly awkward and unsexy when she walked now, and partly because any movement caused her already active belly to erupt into so much activity that it could not only be seen through her dress, but threatened to knock her over.

"I think is going pretty good," she said, getting out of breath.

The crew agreed.

"So how much longer before I can sit down?"

An hour had passed and Catt felt the strain more than ever. Her belly felt like it would crush her hips and snap her spine forward, not to mention the skin was feeling more stretched and sensitive than ever under her dress. She rubbed her back and belly with a loud groan. The necklace had been growing lightly all night. She could even feel it working its magic. Catt thought she now understood something, how Jennifer Lawrence blew up in front of everyone and people only thought it was kind of strange. She only really saw because she was so focused on her. But nobody was that focused on Catt, a fact she was glad of right now. The necklace must emit some kind of field, she thought, that hides the strangeness of a perfectly normal woman becoming hugely pregnant with multiples in a matter of days. It was why everyone was surprised by her size, but nobody thought it insane or impossible, unless they really thought about it. It was also partly why Catt didn't think it so unusual herself anymore, even though by all logic she should be in a hospital surrounded by scientists being studied while they made sure she didn't explode.

But it was hard to keep that train of thought in her mind. She was starting to get short with people, and hungry. If everyone wasn't invited in to sit down soon Catt would just go herself. Who would stop her? By her estimate she was roughly the size and weight of a young elephant, and who was going to mess with that.

Finally, the non-stars like her started to go inside. Catt waddled her way towards the door, only a few other actors still around her. Then, she stopped when she saw somebody coming towards her.

Oh, great, Catt thought as she forced a giant smile onto her face, which she was more than ever aware of how round it had gotten.

Catt may have been putting on the biggest fake smile she could muster, but Maria Menounos approached actually smiling, and it was one of the most sincere and infuriating expressions of glee Catt had ever seen. Catt waited for her to get closer to say anything, irritating with how Maria's silver dress highlighted every sexy curve of her body in the exact opposite way that Catt's dress did to her. Maria looked up and down Catt, half-circling her, apparently unable to speak. But at least I would have had some dignity about it, Catt thought.

Catt was too tired and uncomfortable to continue with their normal passive aggressive banter for more than a few sentences, which had passed. Plus, her stomach was acting up again, slight movements growing across her insides. Soon she'd probably have to sit down.

She did know it, but forgot it. "Pregnancy brain, right?" Maria smiled even wider, suddenly reaching out and rubbing Catt's belly with both hands. "How does it feel? It's so hard, I bet it's uncomfortable."

Catt rolled her eyes and put her hands to her sides, feeling the movements inside grow stronger. Brushing Maria away with any force would destabilize her at this point. Maria either ignored or didn't sense Catt's annoyance, but just kept her hands on her giant belly. A bump pushed up and rolled under Maria's hand. She yelped and laughed it.

"I'm just going to say it," Maria said, looking right into Catt's eyes, "How much have you gained?"

Catt glared at her, and then winced, holding her belly tighter. Maria finally took her hands away. It was that stretching feeling again. She could even swear her dress felt tight around her sides, each kicking movement causing her belly to sting a little as her skin was even more taut than her dress.

"Mmmm," Catt moaned, "I don't know."

"That's probably for the best, I know I wouldn't want to know," Maria said. Having had to work much harder to get her figure than Catt did, weight was a more sensitive issue for Maria. "I'm surprised they're having you work the show and not stay at the studio."

"I insisted. I'm not letting this stop me from doing my job," Catt said proudly.

"I'm impressed," Maria said, half honestly, "If I was half your size I wouldn't show myself in public until I was back to normal."

"I guess I just think some things are more important than," Catt winced again, holding her tummy and having to shift her feet to avoid stumbling, "Uhg. More important than being the prettiest girl in the room," she glared at Maria. Catt was aware she could be vain, but Maria with Maria it was one of the defining characteristics.

Maria was obviously somewhat annoyed that she wasn't able to bother Catt more than she was. Then a light lit up in her eyes.

"I have an idea. Why don't you present the award with me?"

Catt stammered, "I don't know about that . . ."

"Why not? We make a great team, and it's only for a few minutes. What are you afraid of? Oh, I'm sure it's harder to walk up stairs, not being able to see your feet must be a pain, but I promise to slow down to let you keep up with me."

Catt just glared at her. She had already proven that she could be in public like this, and do her job like this, but she was the end of her rope. She just wanted to lie down and pass out until it was over. She rubbed her back, feeling it ache with the weight pulling every bone in her spine forward. She shifted her legs. Her hips were getting painfully sore. And the editing and audio awards were always the last thing to be given out. It'd be hours from now.

"Oh," Maria turned to the camera crew as she stood next to Catt in profile, "And let's get a good shot of us together. It'll be fun," she said, making sure her slim body lined up exactly with Catt's now massive one. "So, what do you think, Catt? Are you up for it?"

Through a forced smile, Catt agreed. "I would love to join you on stage, Maria."

Maria looked surprised, but not displeased. "Oh, great! Come on, let's get backstage. I'll bet you'd like to get off your feet."

"No thanks, it'll just make it harder to, er, stand . . . back . . . " Catt let the sentence trail off as she saw Maria's face brighten at that. Catt waddled after Maria, directing her to come along. They had to go down some narrow halls once inside, and Catt found it impossible to let anyone pass. People made way for her, though. She was breathing heavily when they reached the waiting area backstage. Catt wanted to bend down and rest her hands on her knees, but her enormous belly prevented any action that could be remotely acrobatic. She rubbed her stomach gently, unable to fully reach around to the front. Maria seemed to appear out of nowhere, although she was standing next to her the whole time. Maria once again reached over and pressed her hand into Catt's belly. The ceaseless activity inside lessened. Catt closed her eyes and breathed a sigh of relief. She still felt wiggling, and churning, and soft movements of all sorts, but they slackened, no longer threatening to knock her over.

She opened her eyes, an almost pleasant expression on her face. She saw Maria looking right into her eyes wearing yet another triumphant grin.

"Are you enjoying this?" she asked, rubbing her belly a little harder before taking her hand away.

Catt's temper flared before she could stop herself. "Shut the hell up."

Maria seemed startled, but looked pleased again. It was killing Catt how much Maria was enjoying this. Catt was uncomfortable, humiliated, and enormous, and everything she did was making Maria's day. Catt wished she hadn't agreed to present the award. She wished she just let her better sense prevail and called it a night. She already proved her point. Now and for the next hour her whole existence would be making Maria feel good about herself.

Catt tried hard not to look at all the beautiful people passing her by. Their dresses looked so lovely on them, whereas hers felt tight somehow. It seemed impossible that she could still be growing, but she knew the signs. The fabric along the side of her belly was noticeably tighter. At the start of the evening, her popped belly button was only somewhat visible beneath her dress, now it stood out like a tight bulb. She didn't care anymore that she couldn't keep her hands from massaging her belly. Anything to stop the constant movements inside her from getting worse.

Finally, after what seemed like a lifetime, Maria and Catt were up. Maria started walking, but Catt stopped, holding her belly.

"Oooh, wait, wait--" she said between breaths. It was the tightening feeling again. Maria looked back and flashed her biggest, prettiest, nastiest smile yet.

"Waiting," she said as the pain passed. Catt followed, and just before they left the curtain, Maria turned behind her and said in a deceptively sweet voice, "In case I don't get a chance to say this later, Catt, you have no idea how happy seeing you as a big, waddling ball of fat has made me."

Catt glared, and wanted to shout something about it being uncalled for, and rude, and pretty pointless considering how Maria had made her pleasure at seeing Catt so pregnant pretty obviously. But she didn't. She knew enough about Maria that it was obviously just one last thing to get her to loose her cool, as if she didn't feel awful enough going on stage like this.

Holding her head high and refusing to take Maria's bait, Catt followed Maria one stage. Maria didn't wait for her, she walked right up to the microphone and then turned as Catt struggled to keep up. As she stopped next to her, her belly bumped the microphone stand, nearly toppling it over.

"Oops!" she said loudly, was Maria grabbed it. Maria looked sweetly/evily at her as she opened the envelope.

"It is always an honor to present these awards to the fine men and women behind the scenes, the ones who we couldn't do our jobs without, and who make us look so good in the process," she turned to Catt with that. Catt started to speak, but Maria cut her off by flipping open the envelope.

"The nominees are . . ."

Catt winced, holding her belly tightly. She tried not to make it obvious, but a quiet wave of sound through the crowd told her that some of them noticed. She felt the churning inside her spike, her skin stinging, as her belly then settled down as quickly as it started.
